name: Opal
description:
Opal's mom was pulled from a shelter in Tennessee and gave birth at a vet clinic on May 21st, 2018.  Opal lived at the clinic for 13 weeks and on August 20th she became part of the Paws New England family and was moved to a foster home with her 2 brothers!

Opal has a beautiful, unique coloring.  Her fur is a brown with dark brown spots and some white markings. She has long, thin legs and loves to put them to use running and playing.  Opal is an absolutely gorgeous puppy and will grow into a gorgeous dog! 

Name:  Opal
Sex:  Female
Breed:  Mixed - possibly hound
Age:  13 weeks (DOB 5/21/18)
Weight: 14 pounds as of 8/18/18
Spayed/Neutered: No, will require commitment to spay/neuter upon adoption. See below.
Vaccinations: Up to date in the puppy series. May require additional vaccinations post adoption at expense of adopter.
Heartworm: Too young to test, on preventative.
Microchipped: Will be before adoption
 
BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Cats: Unknown but puppies usually do well with cats with proper introductions.
Good with Kids: Yes

Puppy Donation:  $500.00  (includes spay/neuter surgery to be arranged by Paws New England at a partner veterinarian in several locations throughout New England).  If adopter wishes to have his/her own veterinarian perform the surgery, $100 will be reimbursed upon proof of spay/neuter.


IMPORTANT INFORMATION:
Interested in a specific dog, please fill out an application if you are interested in a dog. The number of individual inquiries is overwhelming and we are finding it difficult to respond to each one. We cannot guarantee you will receive a timely response.
 
Paws New England is a rescue, not a shelter, and as such we do not have our dogs housed in one location - they are in foster homes both in New England and in our southern foster homes.   If you're interested in a specific dog, please complete a short online application and you will receive a reply within 48 hours so you can ask questions.
 
At present, if a dog is listed on our website, the dog is considered still available HOWEVER, may have applications that have come in before yours but it's still too early to know if any are a good match; therefore we encourage you to apply.
 
NOTICE WITH REGARD TO LOCATION OF DOGS:  Please note: Paws New England is a foster-based rescue. We do not have a brick and mortar building to house the dogs we rescue. We have found that dogs in foster homes are much more adoptable because they have been observed in a home setting. Dogs listed with Paws New England typically reside in various locations throughout the south (primarily Tennessee, Texas, and Arkansas) and New England (not necessarily in the state of Rhode Island). You will be notified by the adoption coordinator of the location of the dog you are interested in so you have the ability to decide whether to pursue adoption or not.

Dogs transported to New England are done so at a fee of $150.00 paid directly to the transporting company by Paws New England; no additional transport costs are responsibility of adopter. This fee is included in the adoption donation.

Adoption donations cover pre-adoption vet costs (including vaccinations, spay/neuter when age appropriate, and heartworm testing/treatment when necessary), a microchip, and transportation to New England if necessary.
Donations for our young, healthy puppies and dogs support their fellow canines of advanced age or suffering from injuries and abuse whose donations are reduced but whose veterinary costs are typically much higher. We appreciate your understanding that your dog will help others in need.

All known information about the animal is listed above. We do our best to give accurate information, but most of our dogs are rescues and do not come with a known history.

Paws New England abides by the dog importation regulations set forth in the states of MA, CT, NH and RI.

name: Sassy Bell
description:
Hi! My name is Sassy. 

My owner recently died and I found myself looking for a new forever home. I love to run in my big yard. I’m still a little shy and unsure how to play with toys because I never had toys or anyone to play with but I am getting the hang of it!  I’m very sweet and just a big love bug! I I have really come out of my shell and come up to you to get my head scratched. I don’t bark a lot and I love affection and attention. I’m doing fine with my finders big dog and her bossy schnauzers. I’ve never been around cats or kids, but I’m laid back and shy so I think I would like some older kids to play with. 

My ideal home would be a moderately active family with some teenage kids who could maybe teach me to play ball and take me on walks. I’m currently learning how to walk on a leash.  I enjoy being indoors laying around or outside playing with the other dogs. Im doggy door trained and have had no accidents inside! 

Please consider adding me to your family! I would love you forever! 

Name: Sassy
Sex: Female
Breed: Lab mix
Age: 2 years old 
Weight: 47 lbs on 8/7/18
Spayed: Yes
Vaccination: Up to date 7/27/18
Heartworm: Negative 
Microchip: Will be prior to adoption


BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Dogs: Yes- gets along well with other dogs 
Cats: Unknown 
Kids: Yes- based on personality. Older children best due to size. 


Adoption Donation: $450.00

name: Nila
description:
My name is Nila! I was found as a stray and now I cannot wait to find my forever home! I walk well on a leash, I’m good in my crate, and I’m working on potty training. My foster mom says I am very sweet and I love attention. I know how to sit for a treat. My favorite thing is to be with my human and getting lots of love and attention from my family.  I also LOVE toys and I love to run in my foster moms big yard. 

Please consider giving me an amazing forever home! I promise to love you in return! 

Name: Nila
Age: estimated D. O. B. 10/31/17
Sex: Female
Breed: lab/Aussie/heeler mix (best guess)
Weight: 46 pounds
Spayed: Yes
Vaccines: Up to date on 7/31/18
Heartworm: Negative
Microchip: Will be prior to adoption

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Dogs: Has had minimal exposure to other dogs but should do well with slow and proper introductions 
Cats: Unknown 
Kids: Yes- based on personality. Due to size would do best with older dogs. 

Adoption Donation: $450.00

name: Spot Dot
description:
Meet Spot! Spot was brought in to one of our partner shelters after a good Samaritan found him. Spot is so excited at the thought of finding a family who will love him forever and give him lots of attention. Spot is a young dog who has some energy to burn! He’d love to be able to play with some canine friends, go for walks or hikes, or just chase a ball. Spot is so excited about the thought of hanging out and spending quality time with his new human. Spot is still a little timid in new situations, so he asks that you go slow and be patient with him. Once he can test the waters, he’s all in!
 
Name: Spot Dot
Breed: Hound mix
Sex: Male
Age: 10 months old as of 8/18/18
Weight: 44 pounds as of 8/18/18
Spayed/Neutered: Yes

name: Brownie
description:
With a stunning, silky soft coat and the perfect personality to match, Brownie is anxiously waiting for her forever family. Brownie is easy-going, loving, sweet and just all around a great dog. She plays well with other dogs, loves to be around people and is also content relaxing in the sun. Brownie will easily fit in to just about any lifestyle or family. As long as you can provide her with the love and attention she deserves, she won’t complain one bit! Get your applications in- Brownie is waiting for you!

name: Elijah
description:
Introducing the handsome Elijah! Elijah is your typical puppy anxiously waiting for his forever family to come scoop him up. Elijah is super sweet, loves affection and will make an awesome companion for just about anyone. As long as there are lots of cuddles, playtime and love, Elijah is in! Like all puppies, Elijah needs adopters committed to basic puppy training and obedience, but he’s smart and eager to learn. Elijah is hoping you fall in love with his cuteness, and knows you’ll fall in love with his personality shortly thereafter!

name: Elwood
description:
This little fluffball is Elwood! He was brought in as a stray to one of our partner shelters. Now fully vetted, Elwood is looking for his forever family! Elwood is your typical puppy who loves to run around a play. He does great with his canine friends and everyone else he meets. We do have to disclose that Elwood thinks it’s hilarious to nibble at ankles. He thinks he’s being cute and expects all of the attention. We’re thinking as Elwood develops his manners and obedience, he will quickly grow out of his sassy habit. Get your applications in for this little cutie.

Name: Elwood
Breed: Collie mix
Sex: Male
Age: 19 weeks old as of 8/18/18

Blue plays well with his canine friends and loves to be around his people. He just wants to please you and be rewarded with love and attention- treats too, if you have them! Blue is a young dog looking for a forever family who can show him what the good life is all about. Apply today to make this handsome fella part of your family!

name: Jon Boy
description:
This happy boy is Jon Boy! Jon Boy was found in rough shape and brought into one of our partner shelters where he has been all fixed up and is ready to go home with his forever family. We suspect his scarring is from some type of chemical burn, but thankfully all of that is in the past! Jon Boy doesn’t let his past affect him because he’s focused on a bright future with a family who will love him unconditionally! Jon Boy is an all-around great dog. He plays well with other dogs, is affectionate and is extremely happy! He is almost fully housetrained, and is very smart and eager to please. Get your applications in for this deserving boy!

name: Elaine Benes
description:
Elaine is an easy, easy girl to love. She arrives to PAWS from our partner shelter in TN where she arrived as a stray. Arriving spayed and knowing some commands they knew this gal must have belonged to someone, however, no one ever came forward. After an extensive search for her owners this sweet girl is now available for adoption. 

Elaine is a calm and well mannered dog. She's a smarty who already knows sit and down! She loves to play with tennis balls and will entertain herself for quite some time. She plays well with calmer dogs, but doesn't appreciate those young/hyper dog shenanigans. Elaine is an easy girl to be around and is going to make a lucky family very happy!! 

Name: Elaine Benes
Sex: Female
Breed: Labrador mix
Age: Approx. 6 years old
Weight: Appox 35 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes, previously spayed
Vaccinations: Up to date as of 7/6/18
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with dogs: Yes
Good with cats: Passed initial cat test. May do well with proper introductions and continued socialization
Good with kids: Unknown. Based on personality we think she will do fine


Adoption Donation: $450

description:
Attn: Beagle Lovers! Sadie was surrendered to one of our partner shelters with her brother, Campbell. Campbell and Sadie were outdoor dogs who never got to experience what it was like to truly be part of a family. But all that changes now! name: Princess
description:
You really won't meet a happier girl!! Princess arrives to PAWS from our partner shelter in TN after arriving to them as a stray. She was already spayed and microchipped when she arrived to the shelter and obviously belonged to someone. The shelter was able to get in touch with her owner, who declined to come to the shelter to get her. Their loss!!! We are more than happy to welcome Princess into the PAWS family and help her fine a forever family who will cherish her!!

Princess seems to love every human and dog she meets. She doesn't seem to know a stranger!! She loves to play in the water and will all day if you'll let her. She also enjoys romping with her canine friends at the park. We think she'd do well with another active and playful dog in the home who won't mind all of the playing and romping that she loves to do. 

This gal is a gem and is going to make the perfect family dog! 

Name: Princess 
Sex: Female
Breed: Pitbull Terrier mix
Age: Approx. 2 years old
Weight: Appox 45 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes, previously spayed
Vaccinations: Up to date as of 5/21/18
Heartworm: Negative as of 5/21/18
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with dogs: Yes
Good with cats: Passed initial cat test. May do well with proper introductions and continued socialization
Good with kids: Unknown. Based on personality we think she will do fine

description:
Buck is a true beagle boy! He puts his nose to the ground and is happy to follow wherever it takes him! This happy go lucky fella enjoys playing with his canine friends at the dog park and doesn't seem to know a stranger. Our friends down in TN say he's one cool dude and a joy to be around. True to his breed his will howl from time to time, but is not overly noisy. 

If you love Beagles then Buck is the dude for you! 

Name: Buck the Beagle
Sex: Male
Breed: Beagle
Age: Approx. 8 years old
Weight: Appox 20 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes, on 8/14/18
Vaccinations: Up to date as of 7/16/18
Microchipped: Yes, on 8/14/18

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with dogs: Yes
Good with cats: Passed initial cat test. May do well with proper introductions and continued socialization
Good with kids: Unknown. Based on personality we think she will do fine


Adoption Donation: $250


IMPORTANT INFORMATION:
Interested in a specific dog, please fill out an application if you are interested in a dog. The number of individual inquiries is overwhelming and we are finding it difficult to respond to each one. We cannot guarantee you will receive a timely response.
 
Paws New England is a rescue, not a shelter, and as such we do not have our dogs housed in one location - they are in foster homes both in New England and in our southern foster homes.   If you're interested in a specific dog, please complete a short online application and you will receive a reply within 48 hours so you can ask questions.
 
At present, if a dog is listed on our website, the dog is considered still available HOWEVER, may have applications that have come in before yours but it's still too early to know if any are a good match; therefore we encourage you to apply.
 
NOTICE WITH REGARD TO LOCATION OF DOGS:  Please note: Paws New England is a foster-based rescue. We do not have a brick and mortar building to house the dogs we rescue. We have found that dogs in foster homes are much more adoptable because they have been observed in a home setting. Dogs listed with Paws New England typically reside in various locations throughout the south (primarily Tennessee, Texas, and Arkansas) and New England (not necessarily in the state of Rhode Island). You will be notified by the adoption coordinator of the location of the dog you are interested in so you have the ability to decide whether to pursue adoption or not.

Dogs transported to New England are done so at a fee of $150.00 paid directly to the transporting company by Paws New England; no additional transport costs are responsibility of adopter. This fee is included in the adoption donation.

Adoption donations cover pre-adoption vet costs (including vaccinations, spay/neuter when age appropriate, and heartworm testing/treatment when necessary), a microchip, and transportation to New England if necessary.
Donations for our young, healthy puppies and dogs support their fellow canines of advanced age or suffering from injuries and abuse whose donations are reduced but whose veterinary costs are typically much higher. We appreciate your understanding that your dog will help others in need.

All known information about the animal is listed above. We do our best to give accurate information, but most of our dogs are rescues and do not come with a known history.

Paws New England abides by the dog importation regulations set forth in the states of MA, CT, NH and RI.

name: Willow Tree
description:
Willow Tree is a happy and playful 8 month old black lab mix who can't wait to find her forever home! She arrives to PAWS from our parter shelter in TN after losing her home. Unfortunately, her owner fell on hard times and was no longer able to keep her. 

Willow enjoys playing with her doggy friends and would make a great playmate for another friendly and playful dog. She is eager to learn and we think she'd make a great candidate for positive training. She continues to work on her leash manners and will need a family who can make a commitment to continuing that. 

This sweet girl can't wait to find her forever home! 

Name: Willow Tree
Sex: Female
Breed: Black lab mix
Age: Approx. 8 months old

name: Reno AlwaysTrue, Levi LoveMeDo
description:
Levi and Reno are two ADORABLE beagle brothers looking for a new home.  The boys love each other very much and have always been together, and we’d like to keep it that way!  

Levi and Reno are 7 years old, and two years ago had the good fortune of being purchased by a hunting family that spoils their dogs!  For the past two years they have been very well loved and cared for.  Not long ago, their people had a change of heart and decided to stop hunting.  Instead of selling Levi and Reno to another hunter, they wanted to give them early retirement and a life of indoor leisure and love.  Sadly, their other indoor dogs were unwilling to share the couch, so the owners asked us if we could find a new home for them together.  We said sure! 

These boys are very affectionate, both with each other and with humans.  Reno is generally very social and is a true Velcro dog; he wants to be as close to you as possible, and preferably, closer to you than any of the other dogs.  We’re working with him on sharing his humans, but this will likely be an ongoing process.  Levi lets Reno take the lead and is a tad bit more cautious when interacting with humans.  He usually arrives a little more slowly and stays within reach, but takes a bit more time to warm up. 

They are currently fostering with 3 other dogs, 1 other beagle and 2 large dogs, and have done fine with them with the proper slow introductions.  They are true beagles and LOVE to follow their noses!  Such a kick to watch those tails and butts wiggle and wag as they follow a scent trail as far as they can!  

Both boys are quick learners and very food motivated!  It took Reno about 2.3 seconds to figure out the couch! HAH!  They are house-broken and we’re now working on leash-training and Off. 

Levi and Reno are fostering with another former hunting beagle looking for her forever home, so if you think a trio of beagles sounds even better than a duet, check out the bio for Gracie GoodGirlSunshine, too! 

If you’re ready for some LoveMeDo, Always True pupper love, get your application in now to learn more about these adorable boys!  

Name: Levi LoveMeDo
Breed: Beagle mix
Sex: Male
Age: 7 years old
Weight: 28 pounds 
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative
Microchipped: Yes

Name: Reno AlwaysTrue
Breed: Beagle mix
Sex: Male
Age: 7 years old
Weight: 25 pounds 
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Yes- based on personality 
Good with Dogs: Yes- with proper introductions 
Good with Cats: Unknown

name: Gracie Sunshine
description:
Sweet Gracie is sooooo ready to flood your life with sunshine!  She spent most of her life in a chicken coop until the day she made her escape and was rescued.  Lucky girl!  Now she’s learning all about air conditioning and soft beds and couches and doggie buddies and nice, attentive humans who want to shower her with love.  Being in a home with other well-loved and social dogs has helped tremendously! 

But she is taking these new steps gradually and is understandably cautious.  Gracie needs proper introductions with new dogs - she does fine with very brief initial interactions, but when they stay too close for too long, she gets nervous.  She is currently fostering with 4 other dogs – 2 beagles and 2 large dogs – and she has done fine with them with the proper slow introductions.  

Gracie is a true beagle and LOVES to follow her nose!  She will follow a scent trail as far as she can (so fun to watch!) and will try to chase small critters in motion, such as squirrels, birds, and cats. 

Gracie is currently fostering with two other former hunting beagles looking for their forever homes – Levi LoveMeDo and Reno AlwaysTrue.  If you think a trio of beagles might be just the ticket, check out the bios for Levi and Reno, too! 

Gracie is a smart girl, eager to learn, and very food motivated!  She is house-broken and we’re now working on leash-training! 

If you think some beagle sunshine might be right for you, fill out an application to learn more about Gracie! 
 

Name: Gracie Good Girl Sunshine
Breed: Beagle mix
Sex: Female
Age: 7-8 years old
Weight: 24 pounds 
Spayed/Neutered: Will be before adoption 
Vaccinations: Up to date
Microchipped: Will be before adoption 

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Yes- based on personality

name: Blitz
description:
Ready, set, BLITZ! 

Blitz is an adorable Boxer mix who was found as a stray. He quickly became a shelter favorite and now he can’t wait to find be the favorite in his forever home! He loves food, toys, playing fetch, walks, and belly rubs! Blitz is great with kids and other dogs! 

He is learning quickly from his foster family and knows sit, stay, down, fetch it, and come! He rides great in a car. Blitz is completely hosuebroken! He will even let you know that he needs to go outside to potty. Blitz would love being in an active forever home with children! He loves going on walks and even runs! 

Name:  Blitz 
Sex:  Male
Breed:  Boxer mix 
Age:  3-4 years
Weight:  45 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date 
Microchipped:  Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:

name: Milis
description:
You can't say this boy doesn't try!!  https://youtu.be/6NQYJ4RxbNA

MILIS is Irish for "sweet" - and we thought this was a fitting name for a little boy who has been through so much in his young life.

Milis landed with us after one our rescuer friends in Memphis saw him get hit by a car as he was standing in the middle of the road - she couldn't believe her eyes - she followed him as he ran off as it was clear he was severely injured and she was able to find him in some brush obviously hurt and suffering so off to the veterinary ER he went.  He was transferred to a specialty practice where Milis underwent repair of both legs which had suffered multiple fractures.  

It was noted on x-ray that this boy had a belly full of bones - obviously had been eating them most likely because he was starving.

He's all fixed up now and he's hopefully going to do just great- both legs are splinted and he will be kept immobile for 2-3 weeks and then head back to the veterinarian to be checked.  He's int he care of a great foster mom and she is making sure he's comfy and she's going to work to get some weight on him.

We don't know much  more about this guy for right now but will update this bio as we learn more.  


8/17 update. 
Milis is now fostering in New England. Milis loves his people, is currently fostering with 4 dogs ( 9lbs to 80 lbs, females and males) and 2 cats and doing great. He ignores the cats and right now does not really play with other dogs.
He sleeps in his crate at night without a peep. Does not like to be in his crate unless he can see you. Still working on housetraining, just need to be consistent. 
Ideal home for him would be quiet without a lot of chaos and where person/couple  either works from home,are retired or owns their own home and doesn't mind barking while they are gone.



Name: Milis
Breed: Basenji/Feist mix ?
Sex: Male
Age: 1- 2 years approx.
Weight: 13.0
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Would recommend dog savvy  children over 12
Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Cats: Fostering with cats and ignores them.

name: Piper Peanut
description:
Teeny Piper - little body, big personality!!!  

She packs more action into her 3 lb little body than most other dogs - she's adorable and happy and a puppy so she'll need some training - please give a lot of thought to whether you have the time and patience!  Just because she's little doesn't mean she won't be work!!

This peanut was found as a stray in Brighton Tennessee and was taken to the local shelter (Tipton County); the group that works with the shelter was  kind enough to let us have this baby when we asked - she was too cute to not beg for!!

Piper is arriving to New England on 8/18 and will be local and getting ready for her forever home.

Name: Piper Peanut
Breed: Chihuahua
Sex: Female
Age: 12 weeks
Weight: 3 lbs
Spayed/Neutered: No (too young/little - spay contract will be required and strictly enforced)
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm:  Too young to test
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Older children preferred - she's awful little to be playing with toddlers.
Good with Dogs:  Yes
Good with Cats: Unknown (more concerned about her with a cat than the cat w/ her)

name: Jaggy
description:
Jaggy is estimated to be a 5 years old Shih Tzu. He is great with other dogs, loves toys and tennis balls, doing great on his potty training and knows how to use a doggy door. He’s typically very laid back, but can let you know when he wants attention. He can normally be found on the floor close to his person sleeping or playing with a toy. He sleeps great in a crate at night. Jaggy does have an eye condition that requires easy cleaning and drops twice daily. He also came to us with itchy/dry skin, and still scratches some, but it’s gotten much better with consistent grooming and good quality food. 

He’s a great boy that anyone would love! Apply today for this amazing guy! 

Name: Jaggy

Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date

name: Patches Walker
description:
Lucky, lucky girl this baby is.....

Adorable, SO sweet, smart and learning crate training already, this girl is on her way to a fantastic new life.

Why is she lucky?  Well, she decided to wander onto a road that one of our rescuer friends happen to be traveling down at 9:30 pm at night - anyone who knows us rescuers, there's no way we'd drive by a dog on the side of the road and keep going - just doesn't happen!!

There she was on the actual road and as Mimi stopped she went to run in the other direction but Mimi knows the drill - calm, soothing voice, no sudden movements and then she had her.  Rushed her home for a bath (covered in fleas) and a good meal.

And there you have it, the next day she's chasing a little boy around his house and they are both having a blast.  That's all it takes to save a life.  Stop your car - care about what's in front of you.

We believe Patches is approx. 10-11 weeks old but will confirm once she gets to the vet for a health check and start her vaccines. 

So far her little personality is shining through - she's playful, loves to be loved on, did we say playful?  And as you can see, she's so far great with kids - chases but no nipping - thoroughly enjoying every second of it.

Here's a quick video of her when Mimi found her - and the next morning, having a ball!!! 
https://youtu.be/_WIyt0oVomc

Name: Patches Walker
Breed: Pit Bull Terrier
Sex: Female
Age: 10 weeks as of 8/13/2018
Weight: 15 lbs as of 8/13/2018
Spayed/Neutered: No  (too young - spay contract will be required)
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Too young to test.
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Yes most definitely
Good with Dogs:  Yes (thus far she is submissive)
Good with Cats:  She's a puppy - can be taught - when exposed, she ran when they hissed!

name: Julia
description:
Julia is a happy girl.  She loves to play, cuddle, and run with the other dogs! She loves toys, and rolling around in her bed.  She is working on house training and with close watching she does well.  She is rock solid crate trained.    She loves being with her people and would love to sleep in the bed with you if you will let her.

Julia came to rescue with her 5 puppies out of a kill shelter.   Her puppies, topple, Risa, Warner and Audrey have already found home through PNE, now it is her turn for the happy ending and new beginning! Apply today for this gorgeous girl!

name: Baby James
description:
My name is James and my friends call me “SWEET BABY JAMES”.  I am a lab mix and my game is playing!!!  I love playing with kids and other dogs, big and small.  I am so handsome, playful, silly and goofy.  I was loved by everyone at the shelter as I had such a loving and calm demeanor.  

I love sitting outside in the morning and watching the ducks with my foster sister, I also love hopping with the frogs in the evening.  I love frogs and try to hop after them!  I love chewing on rawhide treats and peanut butter is my favorite treat.  I get along with everyone at the dog park and I love a good afternoon nap and belly rubs.  I am crate trained and rarely bark except when I am ready to play with my foster sister.  My life started out kind of rough as I lost my family and was hit by a car, these nice ladies loved me so much they have fixed my leg and I am ready to find my forever family.

Please apply today to add me to your family! 
 
 
Name: Baby James
Breed: Lab Mix
Sex: Male
Age: approx. 7 mos as of 8/11/18
Weight:  47 lbs
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: current as of July 2018
Heartworm: Negative 
Microchipped: will be prior to transport
Medical: James had FHO surgery and he might always have a slight limp.
 
BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with Dogs: Yes, he is currently fostered with other dogs and loves to play.
Good with Cats: Unknown – James has not been around cats.
Good with Kids: He is currently not fostered with kids, but has a sweet nature so older gentle children should be OK.

name: Little Man
description:
Dare you to resist this Little Man!! 

Especially when he's in a blue pool - https://youtu.be/jvmuSLukyqY

Just about 4-5 months old - is fostering locally and is adorable -  foster mom says he loves, in no particular order -

*Chasing bugs   
*Chasing his tail   
*Rolling in the grass  
*Being outdoors  
*Other dogs that will play with him

He's learning house training and will go in a crate easily (as long as he's not missing out on any fun)

Little Man is awesome with kids. He just thinks that they are smaller laps that he can lay on. 

Little Man will make an fun addition to any family that understands he is still a puppy and will need continued training. 

FOSTER UPDATE 8/19/2018 -  Little Man is settling in and doing quite well in a doggie daycare setting - it's apparent he absolutely needs more training in terms of socialization with other dogs (seems bigger ones are a bit of a concern to him).  He crates wonderfully and is calm - chews on his antler for as long as you need him too.

He's a strong little boy - while he's good with children, he may be a bit too much for a toddler who may get knocked over.

He loves to play with other dogs - another dog in his home would be ideal - he seems to prefer small dogs in the daycare he's boarding in but we believe with proper introduction he'll do fine.  If another dog does not live in the home, continue socialization is key for this puppy      https://youtu.be/Xm8ARqx2W7g

As a pittie puppy, we will be asking adopters to commit to professional training  - we will refund $250 of the requested donation towards the trainer of adopter's choice (and approved by PNE), with payment made directly to the trainer.


Name: Little Man
Sex: Male
Breed: Terrier Mix
Age: 4-5 months as of 8/10
Weight: 17 pounds as of 8/10
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Too young to test, on preventative.
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Dogs: Yes. Little Man is living with 6 other dogs and doing well. He is learning proper ways to play and share. 

Cats: Unknown put puppies usually do good with cats with slow and proper introductions

Kids: Yes. Little Man has been around kids from 5 years old and up. He loves them. He just looks as them as smaller laps that he can lay in.

name: Maxx-G
description:
Max at play - these are brand new friends - as you can see - he has no issues meeting new 4 leggeds - https://youtu.be/xmyiSqkXXwc


This gorgeous Staffie mix is Max - an almost 1 1/2 year old boy -  energy, he's plenty of it!

Max was brought to our attention by the fine people at the Friends of the Bristol Animal Shelter (in Connecticut) where Maxx had been living for a fairly long time.  He landed with them when he escaped (they believe) from a backyard breeder - no one came to claim him and the shelter volunteer just fell in love.  He stayed with them for a very (very very) long time until it became apparent that his time was running out and they started to desperately search for a new situation.

Many dogs don't do well in a kennel atmosphere especially in one that they don't get much exercise and thus people going to see them typically decide dogs like Maxx are not a good fit. 

Enter John Gagnon's Pet Resort when the Friends staff got some funds together to send him and he just excelled.  John worked with him on some typical shelter dog behavior issues and he has since done fine.  Because funding for his vacation was limited, he was headed back to the shelter but that just couldn't happen so when we were asked to help this boy out, we of course said yes!!

From Cassie his foster mom:

~ Maxx is a work in progress but is definitely a quick learner.
~ Maxx is now being fostered by an awesome volunteer who also happens to be a member of John's staff at the resort.  Here's a summary of her observations of Maxx - hope you enjoy reading it!!
~ Maxx is definitely a love bug that loves to cuddle and have lots of attention.
~ He loves to run, play tug of war, go on adventures, play with other dogs and even just relax and chew on a bone after a long day. 

Since Max has been at our house he has learned a number of things. Before Max would indulge and attack his food but with the help of our dog Lucas and repetitively showing him to “sit” and “wait” until told to eat, he has made quit the progress. He also has learned “paw” and the words “no begging.” Max does pretty well with being unattended in the yard, only with us not too far away. While I am in my garden, Max and Lucas would play or just relax in the grass. 

~ Maxx also loves the water and swimming.
~ He does well in car rides and during bath time. 
~ Max is also very food motivated.

Things to work on:
~ Listening a little better; I think he just gets too excited, so a calm, strict voice is key. 
~ Maxx doesn’t have boundaries of knowing what is his and what isn’t but I believe that could be easily reinforced. 
~ Maxx is definitely a toy hog, he has stolen bones from my dog after been given his own, gladly he is not aggressive about it, we are able to take the bones away with no problem except for his tight grip. 
~ Maxx plays great with other dogs but sometimes gets a little rough but is easily distracted to calm down.
~ Maxx is still in the process of being leash trained; using a harness is beneficial for him. 

CATS:  Surprise, surprise!!! Not only is max great with other dogs, he also doesn’t pay much mind to cats, he will acknowledge them. Give them a sniff and be on his way. 

CHILDREN: Yes!!   Max also does very well with kids while being attended. Max on multiple occasions heard my nephew crying and went right up to him trying to cuddle and give him kisses. Max doesn’t know when too many kisses is enough - maybe not a bad thing?

The perfect home for Max would be a home with another dog, brother or sister that is as playful as him, a family that is active and likes adventures and someone who really has the time and dedication to train him.

If you are looking for a puppy that is already potty trained and just needs some TLC and lots of love, then Max is your boy. He is such a great pup. I will definitely miss Max when he finds his forever home.

"In daycare he really enjoys playing and sometimes need some redirection for playing a little too rough. Since starting daycare his dog-manners have improved greatly! He loves being with other active, playful dogs in daycare.”  –Jackie, daycare manager at John Gagnons Pet Resort

I get along great with other dogs, and will always accept loving and belly rubs from my two-legged friends too! I enjoy playing, but also love a good snuggle sesh. name: Roll
description:
These happy go lucky puppies were left in the night drop box of one of our partner shelters. They love to play with each other and welcome all the attention they can get. They are full of personality, spunk and fun with typical puppy energy. The puppies love everyone they come into contact with. Because they are still puppies, this playful litter will need adopters dedicated to typical puppy training and obedience. Rosebud, Roll and Bud are excited to begin the next chapter of their lives and meet their forever family.


Name: Roll
Breed: Terrier mix
Sex: Female
Age: 22 weeks old as of 8/2/18
Weight: 18 pounds As of 8/2/18
Spayed/Neutered: No, will require commitment to spay/neuter upon adoption. See below.
Vaccinations: Up to date in the puppy series. May require additional vaccinations post adoption at expense of adopter.
Heartworm: Too young to test, on preventative.
Microchipped: Will be before adoption
 
BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Cats: Unknown but puppies usually do well with cats with proper introductions.
Good with Kids: Yes



Puppy Donation:  $500.00  (includes spay/neuter surgery to be arranged by Paws New England at a partner veterinarian in several locations throughout New England).  If adopter wishes to have his/her own veterinarian perform the surgery, $100 will be reimbursed upon proof of spay/neuter.

 
 
IMPORTANT INFORMATION:
Interested in a specific dog, please fill out an application if you are interested in a dog. The number of individual inquiries is overwhelming and we are finding it difficult to respond to each one. We cannot guarantee you will receive a timely response.
 
Paws New England is a rescue, not a shelter, and as such we do not have our dogs housed in one location - they are in foster homes both in New England and in our southern foster homes.   If you're interested in a specific dog, please complete a short online application and you will receive a reply within 48 hours so you can ask questions.
 
At present, if a dog is listed on our website, the dog is considered still available HOWEVER, may have applications that have come in before yours but it's still too early to know if any are a good match; therefore we encourage you to apply.
 

NOTICE WITH REGARD TO LOCATION OF DOGS:  Please note: Paws New England is a foster-based rescue. We do not have a brick and mortar building to house the dogs we rescue. We have found that dogs in foster homes are much more adoptable because they have been observed in a home setting. Dogs listed with Paws New England typically reside in various locations throughout the south (primarily Tennessee, Texas, and Arkansas) and New England (not necessarily in the state of Rhode Island). You will be notified by the adoption coordinator of the location of the dog you are interested in so you have the ability to decide whether to pursue adoption or not.

Dogs transported to New England are done so at a fee of $150.00 paid directly to the transporting company by Paws New England; no additional transport costs are responsibility of adopter. This fee is included in the adoption donation.

Adoption donations cover pre-adoption vet costs (including vaccinations, spay/neuter when age appropriate, and heartworm testing/treatment when necessary), a microchip, and transportation to New England if necessary.

Donations for our young, healthy puppies and dogs support their fellow canines of advanced age or suffering from injuries and abuse whose donations are reduced but whose veterinary costs are typically much higher. We appreciate your understanding that your dog will help others in need.

All known information about the animal is listed above. We do our best to give accurate information, but most of our dogs are rescues and do not come with a known history.

Paws New England abides by the dog importation regulations set forth in the states of MA, CT, NH and RI.

name: Sprite
description:
Sprite might be the perfect dog!  He is a playful 9-month puppy and his foster mom is in love.  Sprite is extremely affectionate and gets along with everyone!  Dogs, cats, kids - you name it.  He's got some energy, but settles down quickly.  He's currently learning how to walk on a leash and is proving to be a quick learner.  

Name: Sprite 
Breed: Australian Cattle Dog mix
Sex: Male
Age: 9 months old as of 8/2/18
Weight: 30 pounds 
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Microchipped: Will be before adoption

name: Whittington
description:
Meet Whittington! Whittington was found by one of our fosters who scooped him up and has been loving him ever since. He is a very sweet boy with puppy energy. He loves to play but is learning to settle down. Whittington does well with children and plays well with his four legged friends. He is learning to walk on a leash without pulling and will need an adopter who is committed to continuing his training. Apply today to make this handsome boy the newest member of your family!
 

Name: Whittington
Breed: Pit Bull Terrier mix
Sex: Male
Age: 7 months old as of 8/2/18
Weight: 38 pounds 
Spayed/Neutered: Will be before adoption 
Vaccinations: Up to date

name: Lady Gilmore
description:
Shiny black coat of gorgeous fur - and bright white teeth - all make for one good looking canine.

This girl, no couch potato here - she wants to play, run, play, run - if you have another dog, she'd love it.  Bigger dogs - her size and up.  

She is a lover of all dogs but she's too much for small dogs and doesn't seem to get it so we think no small dogs in her home.  NO CATS for this girl!!!

Lady's foster mom tells us she walks pretty well on a leash and is housebroken - and she will go into her crate easily!  All nice attributes for a 4 legged!!

Another dog in the home would be fantastic but  if daycare was an option it would be great or of course someone active enough to keep her busy.

Happy to connect you with her foster if you're intersted, all you have to do is ask!

Name: Lady Gilmore
Breed: Pit Bull Terrier/Labrador Retriever
Sex: Female
Age: 1 year (approx).
Weight: 45 lbs
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Older (she's a bit bouncy)
Good with Dogs: Yes, her size and up -no to small dogs
Good with Cats: Definite NO

Adoption Donation: $300.00

name: Timmy
description:
Timmy was a young puppy living out in the country with his siblings and no mama to help them until a PAWS foster took them in. Timmy is a very sweet natured dog who is looking for a family to show him what being a family pet is all about! We know he deserves it!
 
Timmy is shy, but he will let trusted people pet him and he is gaining confidence every day.  He approaches new people cautiously but is willing to get some love from people who allow him to approach on his own terms. He is curious and explores new things which shows he is ready to break out of his shell.
 
Timmy likes toys, loves other dogs and can’t wait to share a home with a fur sibling if you have the room and it will keep Timmy’s confidence growing!  Timmy will flourish if given time to acclimate to his new surroundings.
 
Name: Timmy
Breed: Catahoula/ Collie mix
Sex: Male
Age: 1 year old
Weight: 50 lbs
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm:  Negative
Microchipped: Yes
 
BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with Children: Yes- based on personality.
Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Cats: Unknown. Can cat test on request.
 
 
Adoption Donation:  $450.00

name: Duncan
description:
Meet Duncan and get ready to fall in love! He is such a vibrant, strikingly handsome dog! Look at that face and those freckles on his ears and nose! Duncan is an all around awesome boy!  He is so full of love!  

Duncan is such an intelligent boy who just loves being around people. He even knows a couple of commands and would be so easy to train. If you love dogs that like to play and fetch balls and toys, this is your boy.  He loves to go outside, especially if you’re going, too!  He’s got to be part Lab as he absolutely loves water!  He loves to play in the water and jump through the water if you’ve got the water hose in hand. He is such a good boy and seems to love people, young and old but might do best in a home with older kids as he is a big pup and does get a little excited and energetic at times. He is great with foster’s 12 year old grandson. He is crate trained and is a proper gentleman when it comes to being house trained. Duncan is good with dogs, male and female, with proper introductions. He’s ready for belly rubs and back scratches any time of day and loves to just sit next to you chewing on his toys or catching a quick snooze. He even throws his toys in the air and sometimes he catches them! 

Duncan is ready and waiting to find his new best friend!


Name: Duncan
Breed: Labrador Retriever/Terrier Mix 
Sex: Male
Age: 2-3 years old
Weight: 70 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Yes- would do best with older dogs based on personality. 
Good with Dogs: Yes- gets along with other friendly dogs. 
Good with Cats: Unknown

name: Loki Loo
description:
Meet our handsome big boy,  Loki. And yes, his left ear always sticks to the top of his head.  We think it is simply adorable!!

Loki and his bud, Pepper (also for adoption) found themselves in a dilapidated shelter in the rural south.  One of our foster moms found out about the pair and offered to rescue them.  She is quite glad she did.

Loki looks to be a shephard/hound mix.  He is only about a year old and weighs a hefty 85 pounds.
Loki is crate trained, house trained (with a doggie door) and does well on a leash.  His foster mom calls him her "big goofy baby".  He has lots of energy and would make a great running or hiking partner and be sure that nobody will bother you with him around!! He also loves the water. 

Loki is very loyal, very smart and tries his best to please.  Foster mom has started some training with him, but his adopter will need to continue with basic obedience instruction.

Loki is VERY playful and would just adore a canine companion, but needs to be with dogs near to his size and age, as he thinks he is a small puppy!!  Loki is currently fostering in MO.

This guy will put a smile on anyone's face, maybe yours?

Further questions, email dianegpawsne@aol.com and we will get you an answer.  

Name: Loki Loo
Breed: Shepherd, Hound mix
Sex: Male
Age: 1 year old
Weight: 85 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with Children: Yes-Older due to size, energy level.  
Good with Dogs: Yes- would love a companion, now fostering with four other dogs and does well! Would do best with dogs similar to his size and he seems to prefer females.
Good with Cats: Unknown, but probably not.


Adoption Donation: 450.00

name: Pepper Loo
description:
Meet Pepper, so amazingly gorgeous with her patterned fur and one blue/silver eye!! 

Pepper and her bud, Loki (also for adoption) found themselves in a dilapidated shelter in the rural south.  One of our foster moms found out about the pair and offered to rescue them.  She is quite glad she did.

Pepper is a one year old 45 pound heeler mix. Such a great size!! She is crate trained, housetrained (with a doggie door) and quite smart.  She is a high energy girl that loves to play.  She would do best with an active family, runner/hiker and/or an equally playful canine companion.  She is very good in the house and very responsive to basic commands.  She would strongly benefit from continued basic obedience training as we recommend any young adult dog.
Pepper also loves the water and can be found in the kiddie pool whenever it is filled.  

Pepper's foster mom says she just oozes sweetness and gets along with all, human or canine.  Pepper is currently fostering in MO.

Perhaps, you have a place in your home and heart for this fantastic girl.  She will not let you down.

Further questions, please email dianegpawsne@aol.com and we will get you an answer.


Name: Pepper Loo
Breed: Heeler mix
Sex: Female
Age: 1 year old
Weight: 45 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with Children: Yes- based on personality.
Good with Dogs: Yes- fostering with four other dogs and does well! Does need to be fed separately.

name: Grimli
description:
Grimli is a special boy. Grimli came to us after being found out in the country, he was matted, filthy, flea covered, and just a mess.  We were asked if we could take this boy and of course we did. 

He will need an experienced adopter, as Grimli has some fearful, but manageable behavior. He takes a little to warm up. This might take a day or so.  Once he knows he can trust his human, he is an absolute love bug. He will crawl right up in our lap and give you kisses, push his head under your hand to get petted, and lay next to you.  He needs time to learn to trust, but once he does, he is the sweetest. He does not like fast, uprupt movements.  He is crate trained, but gets nervous when you reach in for him, it is fear, somebody was mean to this poor baby. He walks great on the leash, and knows sit and stay already. He is housebroken.
Grimli is very playful with other dogs, ideally his size or smaller. His ideal new home would have a playmate, it helps his confidence and trust. He needs to be in a calmer household.

Grimli will make a wonderful pet to a family who is willing to give him time to warm up and to trust. 

Are you ready to give him a chance and have a loyal buddy for live?

Name: Grimli
Breed: Mini Australian Shepherd mix
Sex: Male
Age: 2 years old
Weight: 19 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative 
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Unknown- would do best with older children due to fear. 
Good with Dogs: Yes- gets along well with foster siblings big and small
Good with Cats: Yes- fostering with lazy house cats and does well with them

name: Captain
description:
Ahoy Captain!!!

So this boy has quite a story!!  

He was hitchhiking along Route 95 in Virginia when his luck got instantly better - a wonderful man, a naval officer from New England, saw him, drove past him, and then turned around to go back and get him.   And that was just the start!

His rescuer couldn't keep him because he was shipping out a few days after arriving back home and his FB post was sent to Paws New England - and the rest is, well, fabulous!!

It appears that before he was placed in the car heading north he had been living on his own for quite some time - he was timid, afraid of loud noises and quick movements.   Since being with his foster family, he is really starting to blossom and is more confident every day.    He was in tough shape medically when he came to us - not neutered, heartworm positive.  He's now no longer in the baby making business and his heart is doing just fine after treatment - this does not mean he's at any greater risk to get HW again and is just like every other dog in that regard.

HE LOVES CAR RIDES!!

He's currently fostering with two other bully breed dogs - one is his good buddy, the other doesn't like male dogs much so they just look at each other through gates - he has zero reaction when this dog gives him a little grief through the gate.

He's quiet in the house, not a barker, and can be left alone without getting into trouble chewing or causing any damage which is always nice.

His foster mom compares him to a kangaroo - he jumps like one when he's playing and he makes little "roo roo" sounds when he's looking for attention.  

Currently working on leash manners and he's progressing but a little more work is needed in this department. He gets excited when he sees other dogs but redirection helps with this.

Name:   Captain
Breed: Boxer/Terrier
Sex: Male
Age: 2 years 0 months
Weight: 40 lbs
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Recently treated successfully
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Not formally tested.
Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Cats:  No

name: Junius
description:
Attention Bulldog Lovers: Meet Junius! If you’re looking for a gorgeous, gorgeous representative of the bully breed family, this is your guy!

Junius has a zest for life! This fella is all fun and love! He is a total sweetheart who loves people to death and soaks up all the attention he can get.

Junius is a young dog with typical young dog energy and spunk. He’d love an active family who he can play and go on adventures with. There is no question this is a strong and powerful boy so we are looking for someone with breed experience. His leash manners are currently in flux – meaning, working on those!! We are working on stay, jumping and leash reactivity; luckily Junius loves his food and pleasing people so he is easy to train. He has learned to cage, sit and lay down. Junius would benefit from a family who can be dedicated to continued manners and leash training.

He kisses everyone who comes around and follows his foster mom everywhere she goes. Junius does entertain himself when needed, crates nicely (in a sturdy crate) but does seem to be a magician and can get out of the regular wire crates.

Look into his gorgeous amber eyes, and you will fall in love… Junius is just waiting for you scoop him up and spoil him rotten!

Name: Junius
Breed: American Bulldog mix
Sex: Male
Age: 2 years old
Weight: 63 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Microchipped:  Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:

Good with Children: Unknown. Based on personality would do well but recommend older due to his size.
Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Cats: Unknown.

description:
Arriving to New England on 8/18/18!

Zoey and Rambo are an adorable older pair looking for a home to live our their retirement. They are very sweet and great dogs. They both get along amazing with other dogs and even don’t mind cats! They are housebroken, crate, and leash trained. Zoey absolutely LOVES to snuggle. Rambo is a quiet guy and absolutely amazing.

name: Dalton Tackett
description:
Fostering in New England!!

You may want to sit down before you check out all of this cuteness! The Tackett litter was born at one of our amazing volunteer’s house after their mom (Gypsey, also an available PNE dog!) wandered up to her house so pregnant she could barely walk. After being weaned from their mom and being fully vetted, these babies are ready to find forever homes. A fun fact about this litter? We have two puppies that appear to be “normal” lab size and height, and then we have two “low riders” with short, stubby legs! Regardless of their leg size, this litter of four loves to run around and play all day. They also LOVE water. Their foster mom jokingly says they snorkel in the baby pool all day. This group certainly doesn’t lack any personality, and loves everyone they come into contact with. Because they are still puppies, this playful bunch will need adopters dedicated to typical puppy training and obedience- they can’t wait to learn! Michelle, Georgia, Sandy & Dalton are ready and excited to begin the next chapter of their lives and meet their new families.

name: Paris
description:
These stunning beauties were left in the night drop box of one of our partner shelters with their mom, Bridgette, who is also an available PNE dog! With personalities to match their cuteness, this litter is full of fun, spunk and love. They love to play with each other all day, and welcome all the attention that comes their way. Each of these puppies will need adopters dedicated to typical puppy training and obedience. Apply today to bring one of these cuties home! ​Buffee, Paris & Zipper are ready to go forever-home!

Sex: Female

name: Buster Boots
description:
Buster was in the shelter for seven months and we can’t figure out why he wasn’t adopted! He is a gentle, sweet boy. The shelter he was at had been participating in Dogs Playing For Life, and Buster’s designated yard was for the “gentle and dainty“ dogs. In fact, he was labeled one of their “trusted helper“ dogs to show the other dogs how to behave.
 
Buster bonds quickly and very much likes to be with his people. He was not house trained when his foster brought him home, but he is very smart and very eager to please. Since day 2, he has not had an accident in the house! Talk about a smarty pants! He has been out in the house alone without being destructive.  He chews the toys he is given and that is all.  He loves to play with toys and has a very playful side. His favorite thing to do is snuggle up and enjoy your company.

Buster is an amazing dog and will make an amazing family member! 
 

Name: Buster Boots
Breed: Lab Mix
Sex: Male
Age: approx. 3 years
Weight:  60 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Microchipped: yes
 
BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with Dogs: Yes, he seems to be fine with all dogs
Good with Cats: Unknown
Good with Kids: Yes - has been around teenagers and based on personality would do well with younger children as well.

name: Skipper
description:
Ahoy there matey! My name is Skipper and I’m quite the catch if I do say so myself! You can trust me to steer a straight ship as I’m a 10 year old Labrador mix. My teeth are a little worn down but I’m such a sweet guy nobody notices. I walk great on leash, love people and other four legged friends. Everyone says I’m a golden treasure at 38 pounds. What more could you want, right?

name: Mary Elizabeth
description:
Mary Elizabeth now (before her cart which is on the way)   https://youtu.be/NvwBaCS9zgU



Special challenges have been the story of this girl's life - she is missing use of her front legs, one of which is fairly non-existent and one which is too small to be useful but she gets around and obviously has for the 8 or so years of her life.

Surrendered to the shelter by her family for only who knows why she was lucky in that a rescuer was at the shelter who contacted us knowing if she went in, she may not get out.  

She's healthy as a little horse - has had all her vaccinations, is heartworm negative and is ready to roll- and to help with that, we've ordered her a cart that she will be able to use and get around like she's never done before - we can't wait to get it to her - Eddie's Wheel is currently constructing it and it should be ready very soon.

A very sweet girl - gets along with all the other dogs in the house and of course loves humans.

She needs help to get outside to relieve herself and waits for you to help her with that - once she has her cart, she'll be able to run to the door like other dogs and tell you she needs to go out. 

So for now, she has all she needs except one thing- you!

Name: Mary Elizabeth
Breed: Corgi/Dachshund
Sex: Female
Age: 8 years
Weight: 16
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm:  Negative
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Yes 
Good with Dogs:  Yes
Good with Cats: Unknown (but her limited mobility would most likely make this a non-issue)

Adoption Donation: $300.00

name: Gloria
description:
Gloria is a sweet and gentle girl and just a joy to have around. She is currently fostered with another dog, cats, and birds and does well with all of them! She has a very sweet personality and is very eager to please her people. She does great on the leash and is crate and house trained. Gloria gets to join her foster mom a work at a care facility for special needs adults and she loves hanging out with the residents.
 
This amazing dog cannot wait to find an amazing forever family! 

Name: Gloria
Breed: Shepherd Mix
Sex: Female
Age: approx. 2 years
Weight:  50 lbs (but could stand to gain another 5 lbs)
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: current as of June 2018
Heartworm: negative
Microchipped: will be prior to transport
 
BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with Dogs: Yes, she is currently fostered with another dog and has been in another foster home with dogs of varying sizes.
Good with Cats: Yes, she has lived with 3 indoor cats.
Good with Kids: Yes, she is not currently living with kids, but due to her gentle nature we think she would be good with older gentle kids.

name: Bunny
description:
Aptly named - look at those ears! - Bunny is a very sweet girl who loves attention from her people. She takes a little while to warm up to strangers but once you earn her trust she loves you with all her heart. She is fostered with several dogs and cats and does well with them. She is fond of the teenagers in the house, but small kids would probably be a bit overwhelming for her.

Bunny is crate and house trained, walks great on a leash and takes treats nicely. She is currently working on her manners (sitting, not jumping when meeting people) and she is very eager to please so training is a breeze. Overall she loves attention and she loves her toys!

Breed: Shepherd Mix
Sex: Female

Weight:  25 lbs
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: current as of June 2018
Heartworm: Negative 
Microchipped: yes

Good with Dogs: Yes, she is currently fostered with 4 dogs and loves playing with them.

name: Zeus Hound
description:
Zeus was born in rescue as the only puppy to his mom- Mona. He is a loving, goofy, big puppy. He is very smart, stubborn and in true hound fashion will follow his nose to the end of the earth so a fenced in yard is a must for this boy to keep him out of trouble. He has learned to sit for treats, comes when called (unless he has the chance to chase something), and is doing well on his potty training. He is an easy keeper, plays well with the other dog, but he is big and likes to play rough so a companion close to his size might be best.
 
Zeus would love an active family to call his own! 

Name: Zeus
Breed: Hound Mix
Sex: Male
Age: DOB 01/23/18
Weight:  60 pounds 
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: current as of June 2018
Heartworm: negative 
Microchipped: will be prior to transport
 
BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with Dogs: Yes, he is currently fostered with dogs over varying sizes and does well.
Good with Cats: Unknown 
Good with Kids: Yes – older kids should probably be fine. He does not know his own size and might accidentally knocked over smaller children

name: Red Rover
description:
Red is a fun and active dog looking for an adventure partner.  Red has just finished a professional obedience program and has mastered sit, down, come, loose leash walking, and has an awesome “place” command.  He is crate trained, and housebroken.  Red is always ready for a car ride, and loves to be with his people.  He is very treat motivated and a quick learner.  With some guidance, he will make an amazing best friend.

Sex: Male 
Breed:  Pit bull terrier mix
Age:   1.5 years old 
Weight:  45 pounds 
Spayed/Neutered: Yes

name: Ohana
description:
Ohana is searching for her forever home!

Ohana is a playful, happy go lucky sweetie. She loves to play tug, fetch, cuddle and go for walks. She is social and loves people and other dogs. She offers great companionship and likes to curl up into a tight little ball to snuggle. She can be jumpy when overly excited and doesn’t realize how big she is. Her foster is working hard with her on not jumping. She will occasionally whine or whimper when in need of attention or bored. She already understands basic obedient commands and walks on a leash. She is food motivated and will work for a treat. She displays tons of affection and gratitude. She is comfortable in her kennel and will gladly go when asked.

If you are looking for a big best friend than look no further than Ohana!!

Name: Ohana
Sex: Female
Breed: Shepherd/ Hound mix
Age: Approx 5 years
Weight: 70 lbs as of 6/26/18
Spayed: Yes
Vaccines: Will be UTD before adoption
Heartworm: Negative
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Dogs: Gets along beautifully with puppies and all dogs.
Cats: Lives with a cat in foster home. No observed prey drive
Kids: Recommend older kids since she needs training on her jumping. She is gentle but doesn’t realize how big and strong she is.


Adoption Donation: $450.00

name: Quincey
description:
Perserverance and endlessly optimistic are the perfect words to describe Quincey and his life. He is an extremely special guy! He has a great attitude on life and is always happy! Quincey is also very smart and is doing amazing with house training. He gets along well with dogs, cats, and kids. He would prefer dogs closer to his size in a forever home. 

Quincey does have scarring and hair loss across his back that the vet believes are from some type of chemical burn. The hair will likely never grow back so he has a bit of a wonky hair do. We still think he is stunning and love him just the same! 

If you have room in your home and hear for this distinguished and loving older gentleman- apply today! 
 

Name: Quincey
Breed: Chihuahua mix
Sex: Male
Age: 8-9 years old 
Weight: 9 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative 
Microchipped: Will be prior to adoption 
Medical: Quincey has scarring and hair loss across his body most likely causes by chemical burns. The hair will probably never grow back.

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Yes- he is not fostering with children but he is has met and been around children and done well. Due to his size he would be best with gentle, older children.
Good with Dogs: Yes- does well with all dogs but does prefer to play with dogs closer to his size
Good with Cats: Yes- ignores the cat in his foster home

name: Karma
description:
Now fostering in MA!! 
 
Meet Karma! Karma is a happy and exuberant English Bulldog girl after your heart (and her forever home)! Karma is doing excellent in her foster home with her foster dad and other PAWS NE adoptable, Harold Mask. Karma’s foster dad reports that Karma is easily trained, listens well, and just wants to sit at your side and be scratched. Belly rubs are the best and her favorite.  She also walks beautifully on her gentle leader and loves to go on car rides.
 
Karma is still working on keeping all four paws on the ground when she gets excited but is making great progress as she is a wonderful listener. You can always count on Karama to give lots of kisses, be your snuggle buddy and your sous chef! Karma is selective with dogs she likes. However, she currently lives with a 5-month-old puppy who she plays with all day long.  She is the perfect sidekick who just wants to enjoy life with you. Apply today to meet this very special girl! 
 
Name: Karma
Breed: English Bulldog mix
Sex: Female
Age: 2 years old
Weight: 50 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative 
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:

name: Meme Moo
description:
Love a happy ending? Meme was found at a common dump sight covered in mange when her foster mom found her and just couldn’t leave her! It took 3 days for Meme’s foster mom to earn Meme’s trust, but Meme was scooped right up and is now living the good life! Meme is an awesome family dog. She is described as the sweetest girl with lots of exuberance! She loves to run and play, and has become an excellent walking partner. Meme also lives with her 2 ½ year old foster brother whom she ADORES. They love to snuggle together. Meme would rather be in your lap than beside you, and will reportedly lick you to death if she had the chance! Meme also loves to play with dogs similar in size and higher energy like her. Meme is so smart and is learning every day. She is almost 100% housetrained, and is eager to please her people. Cherry on top? One ear flops forward and one flops to the side- it’s too cute!

Name: Meme Moo
Breed: Pit Bull mix
Sex: Female
Age: 9 months old as of 7/12/18
Weight: 30 pounds as of 7/12/18

name: Ray
description:
Meet Ray! Ray is a wonderful Aussie mix who loves life. He was rescued from the local shelter and a few days later he broke with Distemper. We have nursed him back to health and at this time he seems to have recovered without any obvious neurological damage. He is being fostered with three children and does well with them. He is also good with other dogs, but did not have many doggy social skills before coming to his foster home, so he is still learning. In true Aussie fashion he will to “herd” the other dogs which is not always appreciated. 

He is blind, and at times you would never know! His other senses have taken over, and he isn't the least bit bothered by his loss of sight. He suffers from a birth defect, and the doctor says that there should be no ongoing issues with his eyes. Ray is now housebroken and crate trained. Ray would love to find an active family to call his own!
 
 
Name: Ray
Breed: Aussie Mix
Sex: Male
Age: approx. 1 year
Weight:  40 lbs
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: current as of June 2018
Heartworm: negative
Microchipped: will be prior to transport
Medical: Ray is blind. 

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with Dogs: Yes, he is currently fostered with dogs of various sizes.
Good with Cats: Unknown
Good with Kids: He is fostered with three kids and does well with them.

description:
Little Joe was rescued off a country road where dogs are often dumped - he is a lucky, loving, easy going boy.  He loves being with his foster mom and dad and playing with his fur siblings. Little Joe  has a large yard for play and has never spent time in a kennel. He spends most of his time running in the yard with foster mom and her teenage daughter. He tends to be quite a bit more active than his siblings and has been described very active.

Little Joe rides well in a car and is slowly learning leash manners. He is interested in playing fetch but has not mastered the game yet. His ideal home would be one where he gets lots of attention and gets to spend time with his “people” which is what he most enjoys. Little Joe would love some older school-age children to play with. 

He will need an adopter committed to training an energetic puppy.

name: Silver
description:
Silver is a mature Rottie mix. We are guessing his age beween 7-8 years. He is a funny guy because he snorts, snores, and makes sounds like Popeye when he dreams. He was found locked in an abandoned house. He was adopted through the shelter however it was not to an ideal environment and he found his way back to rescue. Silver is fearful at first meeting people we believe because of his past but once he is around them he does well!  He has been with our rescue for 4 weeks now and we are starting to see that goofy side of him and it is absolutely adorable.  Hopefully, the unhappy times of his past will quickly fade and he will be...him! 

He is perfect with dogs, cats, birds and horses. He is potty trained and knows sit. He does not know how to play with toys or fetch a ball. He does know how to be with his person all day and night long, love them with a dogs heart and keep them laughing. 

Please consider giving this special guy a home! 

Check out his video! https://youtu.be/kGfgM845gKg
 

Name: Silver
Breed: Rottie Mix
Sex: Male
Age: approx. 7-8 years old
Weight:  55 lbs (but could stand to gain another 5 lbs)
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Microchipped: yes
 
BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with Dogs: Yes, he is currently fostered with 3 other dogs two of similar sizes and a small dog.
Good with Cats: Yes, he has lived with 3 indoor cats.
Good with Kids: He is not currently fostered with kids, but he is very sweet and gentle so we think older children would be fine.

name: Thursday
description:
Meet Thursday, not a bad day of the week since Friday soon follows, and in this case also the name of an awesome young hound mix girl who ls looking for a forever home. This girl loves people, playing with other dogs, and WATER! She sees it, she is in it!  Maybe she has a bit of lab in her too!

Thursday and her daughter, Wednesday (also for adoption!!), had a home in the south, but unfortunately, a family member developed a neurological condition and his care taking skills declined.  The family reached out to one of the southern fosters and she was more than happy to assist them.

Thursday is thriving in her foster home/dog sanctuary.  She is already very attached to her foster mom.  She is very easy to please and prefers to spend her days playing with her pup and and the other foster dogs.  She does well in a crate, but has been trustworthy outside of one.  Foster mom is busy teaching her basic commands and leash training and she is a very good student, so far!

Want some more info about this great girl?  Email dianegpawsne@aol.com and we will get it for you.

Better pics coming soon!!!

Breed:  Hound mix
Age:  2 years old

Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date 
Microchipped: Will be before adoption
 
BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with Dogs: Yes, plays with all.

name: Wednesday
description:
Now fostering in New England. Foster mom is so in love!!

Meet Wednesday, no, not the actual day of the week, but an adorable hound mix puppy who ls looking for a forever home. This girl loves people, playing with other dogs, and WATER! She sees it, she is in it!  Maybe she has a bit of lab in her too!
Wednesday and her mama, Thursday (also listed for adoption), had a home in the south, but unfortunately, a family member developed a neurological condition and his care taking skills declined.  The family reached out to one of the southern fosters and she was more than happy to assist them.

Wednesday is your typical active happy go lucky puppy. And we think she is going to be a big girl as she is already 45 pounds at only 5-6 months old. Wednesday is being socialized with all the dogs in the foster home/dog sanctuary where she currently resides and she is is such a joy to watch.

Wednesday will need a family committed to puppy and obedience training.  She is a very smart girl who is very receptive to training. Her ideal home would be a young, active couple or family. Living near the water would be a plus, but a kiddie pool would do just fine too.

This girl is ready and excited to begin the next chapter of her life. Why not be a part of it?

name: Poncho
description:
Looking for a mellow sidekick? You know, a little playtime, maybe a walk/drive together, watch a good flick on TV? 

Well, meet Poncho!!

This boy, besides being quite the looker, is also an awesome pooch. This five year old hound mix is currently residing in one of our southern fosters dog sanctuary and she said he is such a pleasure to be with.  Just a go with flow type pup.  
Poncho was found fending for himself after his previous owners left town without him, but he bears no hard feelings.  He is just happy to enjoy each day. Besides playing with his doggie buddies, Poncho loves to go on car rides and is a professional napper!  
He crates very well, though it is not needed, and is quite the conversationalist.  His foster mom says the faces and noises he makes when she talks to him just makes her smile and laugh.
Poncho is very food motivated and smart, so basic training and leash training are progressing well.

Want some more info about this great guy?  Email dianegpawsne@aol.com and we will get it for you.

Sex:  Male
Breed:  Hound/Lab mix
Age:  5 years old
Weight:  63 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative
Microchipped: Will be prior to adoption

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with dogs: Yes
Good with kids: Yes
Good with cats: Had not bothered with cats around his current foster home, but does not actually live with a cat at present.

name: Athena
description:
Need a running partner?  Playmate?  Babysitter??  Look no further, Athena is your girl!!  Athena loves kids, dogs, and cats! 

Athena was found by volunteers chained to a tree without food or water.  Poor Athena was in bad shape when her foster family took her in, but boy oh boy has she blossomed since!  Athena is an extremely sweet and sociable girl.  She previously lived with two little human girls, ages 4 and 6 (one of which is physically handicapped) and she absolutely adores them!  She currently lives with 5 (!!) cats and 2 dogs and gets along with all of them fabulously! 
 
Athena is a great girl and is happy and affectionate with an amazing temperament.  Some of her favorite things include playing with the hose, playing with her puppy friends, playing with anyone who will play with her, and belly rubs.  She is learning to know what toys are and how to play with them.  She prefers not to be crated; however, her foster mom does crate her when nobody is home; when first going into the crate she will yip but it only takes a few minutes for her to settle down.  She has never met a stranger and loves attention from everyone.  She is housebroken already, rides very well in the car, and walks well on a leash.  Overall she is a great girl! 
 
This funny girl is so happy to finally have a home and tries so hard to fit in with her foster family.  She loves to watch TV with her foster dad and actually watches the screen and cocks her head while doing so.  Also, she tries to keep track of her people to be sure they are all okay.  When her foster mom takes time to soak in the bath tub, Athena insists that she leave the door open so she can run in every few minutes to give her foster mom kisses!
 
Athena would love a forever family that is active and would love someone to play with (humans or dogs - she is an equal opportunity playmate).  She is very social and would do well in most settings!  
 

Name: Athena
Breed: Terrier/Heeler mix
Sex: Female
Age: 1-2 years old (may be younger - acts very much like a puppy) 
Weight: 45 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative 
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Yes - loves children!
Good with Dogs: Yes - loves to play! 
Good with Cats: Yes - lives with 5 cats!
