name: Shelby
description:
Shelby is a vibrant year old Shepherd mix pup with a bubbly personality. She enjoys time with her family, running around outside, playing with other dogs, cuddling, and playing fetch. She is working on obedience training and will need a family committed to continuing. She is full of puppy love and energy! 

Shelby has dry eyes and requires eye drops daily so she has no pain or build up in her eyes. Her foster has been doing this for her several months so she is used to the drops and does well with them. 

This precious beautiful girl is content to lay with you indoors or play with you outdoors. Shelby will make an awesome family member!

Check out her video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MnlAdetoqEc

Name:  Shelby
Sex:  Female
Breed:  Shepherd mix
Age:  1 year old 
Weight:  60 pounds 
Spayed/Neutered:  Yes
Vaccinations:  Up to date 
Heartworm:  Negative
Microchipped:  Yes 
Medical: Dry eyes which will require daily drops. 
 
BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Dogs: Yes – Shelby has been around dogs of varying sizes and age & wants to play with them all.
Cats: Unknown – she was curious with some outside cats, but has not been around inside cats.
Kids: Yes – Shelby is very friendly and loves everyone. She hasn’t learned to stay down yet so maybe best for older energetic kids unless parents teach Shelby some manners around younger, smaller children.

name: Mona
description:
Mona was a pregnant, scared stray picked up by animal control on 6/25/18.  She was brought to a Paws New England foster home and on 7/1/18 gave birth to 6 beautiful pups.  

Mona is an amazing mom.  She is very patient and caring, and she shares her food and treats with her puppies.   She has mastered the doggy door, made friends with her foster siblings Reggie and Missy Mae, and is working on leash training.  Everything seems new to Mona but she is happy and wants to make her foster family happy too.  

Mona is calm,  well behaved, and loves other dogs.  She enjoys sitting outside and watching what's going on around her but gets overly excited around cats.    She is gentle when taking treats and loves affection.

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:

name: Hoochie, Que
description:
7.14.18 - Bonded Duo now in New England!

Hoochie and Que were found together in an abandoned building. They are very sweet girls who are bonded and truly love each other. Hoochie is partially blind and relies on Que for guidance and support. They both are very loving and want to please. They enjoy going on walks and hanging out around the house. 

These happy girls are so content together.  They don't mind if the other invades their food or water bowls, and it's perfectly OK if one wants to sleep in the other's bed - they share everything!  They are quiet, just don't try to keep them apart.  No.  Uh uh.  Never.  Not going to happen so don't even try.   

These ladies are great in the car, great with their 3 foster siblings, great meeting people on walks, all around gentle southern lasses.

If you have space in your heart and home for these sweet girls they will reward you with years of love! 
 
Want more info?  pawsjeanne@gmail.com

name: Mimi
description:
ex·u·ber·ant
adjective
filled with or characterized by a lively energy and excitement.
"giddily exuberant crowds"
synonyms: ebullient, buoyant, cheerful, jaunty, lighthearted, high-spirited, exhilarated, excited, elated, exultant, euphoric, 

See Mimi's story from start to almost finish (finish is when she's in her forever home) 
                         https://youtu.be/08q1ZqkCGcM

MIMI - big capital letters for a larger than life girl!!!  

She's arrived in New England and is a lively, exuberant  (hence the word above) pup who is enjoying life to its fullest thanks to her foster family and their canines who can't get enough of her.

Born with a defect that prevents her from extending her legs fully, she compensates by not worrying about it and running like MIMI should.  We will have her see an orthopedic surgeon at our wonderful friends at Cape Cod Veterinary Specialists to see if there's anything that can/should be done to help her with the deformity but for now she seems 100% happy as is - and so are we.


Name: Mimi
Breed: Terrier (maybe Pittie, maybe Jack Russell, maybe some lab)  Whatever the mix, she's perfect.
Sex: Female
Age: 1 year approx. (maybe less...bright white gorgeous teeth!!)
Weight: 32 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative 
Microchipped: Yes
Medical: Deformity in her rear legs

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Yes- older children due to her physical limitations
Good with Dogs: Yes- gets along well with all other dogs!
Good with Cats: Yes- lives with four dogs is curious but not aggressive


Adoption Donation: $450.00

name: Ashleigh
description:
FOSTERING IN NEW ENGLAND!!!!

This sweet, loving girl has patiently waited for a forever family and her time has finally come! After finding herself at one of our partner shelters emaciated and still caring for her puppies, Ashleigh knew her luck would soon turn around. Ashleigh got a full belly, TLC and lots of love! Despite all she’s been through, Ashleigh doesn’t let any of her past bring her down. 

Ashleigh is happy and full of life. She gets along with all dogs and people she meets.  She loves going for walks and pays it forward by walking nicely on a leash. And, do you know who loves car rides???  You guessed it, Ashleigh.

She’s just a total sweetheart who wants to be loved. Who is ready to give this very deserving momma a life full of love and pampering?!
 

Name: Ashleigh
Breed: Lab/Pit mix
Sex: Female
Age: 5 years old
Weight: 39 lbs 
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Microchipped: Yes

name: Kiva Viva
description:
Kiva Viva- with a name like that what’s not to love?! Kiva is an extremely lovable catahoula leopard dog mix. He is doing amazing in his foster family and they can’t say enough positive things about him! He is a shadow once he gets to know you and will follow you everywhere. His tail is always on the go and and he can’t wait to cuddle (he is convinced he is a lap dog). Kiva loves toys and food and will love anyone that gives it to him! 

Kiva Viva was found by a good Samaritan hiding in a ditch. He was emaciated with worms and wounds needing to be treated. He is now doing amazing and completely healed! 

He is housetrained and is working hard on basic obedience training. Kiva LOVES other dogs. Due to his size and energy level he would love an active family. He would do best with older children or just adults as he is still working on not jumping. 

Kiva is an amazing guy- could he be the guy for you?!

Sex: Male 
Age: 12 – 15 months
Weight: 64 lbs
Spayed/Neutered: will be prior to adoption
Vaccinations: Up to date
Microchipped: will be prior to adoption

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:

name: Pambazo
description:
Apparently Pambazo's rescuer who found him is a lover of Mexican bread because that's what his name means!!!!

Pambazo is the definition of resilience and he is now looking for his forever home! 

Pambazo was originally found as a stray with an injury to his rear hips and legs.  Once we took him into rescue he was rushed to our friends at Memphis Specialty Vets and found to have several internal injuries and a "majorly" fractured leg - the x-rays are stunning.

He got through his critical stage and did really well postoperatively and off to his foster home he went where he's done very well with his rehab.  He's using the leg now and at this point he's just about ready for his new home.

name: Sabre
description:
Sabre is a total sweetheart! She is about 2.5 years old and a German Shepherd mix.  She was at our local animal shelter and was suffering from fur loss on her feet, legs and tail. Her only way out of the shelter was with a foster family.  Sabre has been with her foster family for over 4 months as her fur continues to regrow, and they absolutely love her!  

Sabre’s fur may never come back at 100%, but that does not stop her from being a stunningly beautiful girl!  Sabre can best be described as puppy in a big dog’s body!  She absolutely loves to play with other dogs-especially puppies!  She has “puppy play” down to a tee, and loves to hang out with her canine friends! She can be a little submissive with some dogs, and will cower down to dogs half her size or smaller!  

Sabre is extremely loving and loves nothing more to be by your side.  She is the perfect companion dog! She is amazing on a leash (her foster mom gave her an A+ on her very first walk) and will make a great walking partner! She is crate trained (not one single accident since she has been in foster home) and house trained (she uses a dog door), loves to play with other dogs, from 20 pounds to 70 pounds, and she has been the perfect guest and gets along great with her 4 foster sibling dogs! She loves to snuggle with both her humans and canine friends, loves toys, loves to get kisses and is an overall fabulous girl who is so easy to love! Sabre will be a great addition to any family!
 
We thought Sabre was just such a sweetheart, that we wanted to show you, potential adopter, how truly special she is. Check out her video here: https://youtu.be/_AijhgE2l4o.

 
Name: Sabre
Sex:  Female
Breed: German Shepherd mix
Age:  2.5 years old
Weight: 70 pounds
Spayed/Neutered:  Yes
Vaccinations:  Up to date 
Microchipped:  Yes 
 
 
BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Dogs: 
Yes –she loves other dogs.  She is great with big, small, young, old, male, and female. She loves, loves, loves to play with other dogs!
Cats:
Yes- she is good with cats and not very interested in them.
Kids: 
Unknown–she does not currently have children in her foster home.

If you are looking for an amazing dog who will make a great companion then look no farther!

name: Kodiak
description:
Special Blockhead seeking Special Home!!

Please take the time to read this long post about this really great dog!!

If you're a blockhead lover, you've come to the right dog!!! This guy is a gorgeous (even more so in person) pittie with a gorgeous face and a lovely personality that will suck you right in! And, if you have a good throwing arm and like to have the ball returned promptly and repeat, today's your day to learn about your next best friend.

Kodiak (Kodi to his friends and family) had a tough beginning to his life but we aren't dwelling on that - what you need to know is that the last three years of his life have been full of love and hard work with his adoptive parents. They took this boy as a foster when we couldn't get anyone else to do it; they not only took him in, they worked with him non-stop to turn him into the happy, confident boy he is today.

Kodi would just as soon sit in your back yard while you toss a ball to him than do anything else - he LOVES his humans and is happy to be involved in anything they are involved in. And once he gets to know your friends, he will love them too.

And now the part that is tough - as happy and adjusted as he is, Kodi is a guarder of his "things" - what's his is his and what is another dog's is his -it's called resource guarding and this includes any toys, treats, balls (especially) and this also includes his people - he wants them all to himself and thus Kodi must be an only dog to truly be able to relax and enjoy life. His family has managed him with another dog in the home but they have mastered this and we aren't sure someone else will want too - so let's just have him be your only dog and it's a no-brainer!!!

His family has visitors to the house all the time, - big humans and smaller ones - he is 100% fine with them if no other dog is present.

Resource guarding can carry a concern when there are young children/toddlers in the home - and this lovely couple were overjoyed to welcome their baby girl into their lives. She is now crawling and starting to walk and it's evident that Kodi will not be sharing any toys/treats or anything of his with her either as long as their other dog is in the are. This creates an unsafe environment for a little one as you can't explain to them that Kodi won't share and if you persist, he may not be happy about it.

To be clear, he has NEVER bit anyone or attempted to bite anyone, especially this baby. And he has played with older children with glee.

This is because he has two parents who are ever-vigilant and knowledgeable and who have worked hard to prevent any accidents.

Kodi's parents have come to a very hard decision - in order for their little one to be completely safe and for Kodi to remain safe as well and make their other dog happy, it's time to find a new home for him - one in which he won't be separated from his humans because of a mini-human - a home where he can roam freely without the worry of someone trying to take his things.

The ideal home we want for Kodi? 
~ Adults only without chaos (teens ok) 
~ Large fenced yard where he can play by himself which he does quite well with his "things." 
~ No dog parks for this boy - too stressful for him.
~ Someone with a good throwing arm

This boy is worth it.

His current family will be involved in his placement as they adore him (as you can see from the photos); he is their boy but they know that in order for him to be truly happy, he needs his own home, his own space and boundaries when with his new loved ones.

Contact for more information: pawsalexandra@gmail.com

Name: Kodi (Kodiak)
Breed: Pit Bull Terrier
Sex: Male
Age: 5 1/2 years approx.
Weight: 66 lbs
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Microchipped: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative, on preventative

name: Sally Chaps
description:
If you’ve ever wanted to become Internet-famous, Sally Chaps is your girl! You already know from her pictures that she’s a gorgeous girl, long-legged with a beautiful brindle and white coat, pretty green eyes, and adorable white “socks” on all four paws. Those pictures also hint at the big, bold, and wonderful personality she has. Sally is spunky and lively, funny and playful, and she’s a great listener who kennels up on command, learned sit with ease, and is housebroken with a doggie door. Whether she’s playing at the park with pals, practicing tricks with her new owner, hiking the Blue Hills, or romping around at home, she’s going to be Instagram gold. Just think of the Instastories you could do with her as the star! 

And if you’re not into social media fame, Sally is cool with that, too: her ideal home is one that gives her lots of love and includes her in fun things like doggie playdates, runs, and agility class, and cameras are totally optional. Sally isn’t a diva, and she would do beautifully in a home with kids and with other fun, friendly dogs or as a solo dog who gets play time with other dogs. Sally has the mind of a comedian in the body of a dog model. Now all she needs is a forever home where she can show off her star quality!

Check out her video here: https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=10211027892722891&id=1522178203

name: Harley
description:
LOOKING FOR AMAZING FOSTER OR ADOPTIVE HOME
If you are even slightly considering helping Harley, please contact: joannepawsne@gmail.com


Super special, amazing, loving, patient, compassionate person needed for..... Harley, a special, amazing, loving, patient girl.

Looking for a foster or adoptive home for this lovely girl Harley.

Harley has a long story but the short version - adopted by a wonderful young lady in Memphis - the dog suffered a paralyzing injury after adoption for which this young lady accepted all responsibility financially and time devoted to rehab - truly nothing short of amazing from a young girl just graduating from college. She adores this dog - of that we are certain.

Harley had a spinal stabilizing surgery and is making amazing progress in physical therapy in Memphis - she can actually stand on her own now while eating and can use her hind legs.

Mary knows that with a new job starting in August after graduating from college, she will just not be able to continue to dedicate the time to Harley that she needs and we have zero problems with this - we know this woman - she's been nothing short of amazing.

We are looking for a home who may have prior experience with dogs with mobility problems - she is NOT incontinent, she can stand a bit, and she needs ongoing physical therapy here in New England - which we will of course cover. You don't have experience but still want to help - no worries, we have volunteers who can guide you in her care.

Please consider joining in on this experience - you won't regret it, honestly. You'll watch this dog flourish and who knows, maybe walk 100% unassisted - wouldn't that be something?

Or complete an online adoption application: www.pawsnewengland.com/adopt or our foster application - www.pawsnewengland.com/foster

name: Khorshid
description:
Hi my name is Korshid!

I am a beautiful white shepherd and I have traveled all the way from Iran!!  I was rescued there as a stray and through the help of PAWS New England was brought here in hopes to find my forever home.

When I was found I had an injured leg. I had surgery and now have pins in my front leg. It doesn’t hurt me anymore but I do walk with a limp. Stairs are hard for me so I would do best in a home that does not have a lot of stairs that I would need to use to get around. I also have low vision so I am cautious when moving around especially in a new place. I tilt my head to help me see better and that helps a bit.Because of these physical limitations I am a bit clumsy when walking around. So I need someone who will be patient with me especially while learning my way around a new house. 

Since I tend to be clumsy and I am a big dog there will need to be precautions when I am around small children. I may knock them over on accident. I do love children though I foster with 3 young kids aging from age 1-8! I also love other dogs. I have 4 other dogs in my foster home. 

I am also house broken and can be left uncrated when alone. I am very content with a dog bed and some chew toys. 
I am a very sweet dog that needs a special family or person to be willing to work with me and help me adjust to my new life. I promise to be a faithful and loving companion for someone who is willing to give me a chance.

Name: Khorshid
Breed: Shepherd mix
Sex: Female
Age: 3 years old
Weight: 55 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Microchipped: Yes
Medical: Has an old leg injury so she walks with a limp. Has some decreased vision. 

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Yes- however due to size and clumsiness would do best with older children. 
Good with Dogs: Yes- gets along well with other dogs. 
Good with Cats: Unknown

name: Georgia
description:
FOSTERING IN NEW ENGLAND!!!!  

Georgia was found along a road and flagged down a wonderful couple who took her home and helped her find her way to PAWS New England.  Since that very moment, Georgia has repaid her gratitude by being a friendly, loveable companion for her southern foster family (which includes children!).

Georgia is full of energy, spunk and special cries for attention. She loved playing with the kids in her Southern foster home. She has been very trainable, now knowing how to walk on a leash, sit on command, be gentle when taking food,and load up into a vehicle with no problems. She sleeps in a kennel at night inside and has become quite accustomed to her new digs. 

Georgia is housetrained, gorgeous, loveable and looking for a home who will give her all the love and attention she desires from her human companions.

One day she went to her partner shelter to hang out with some cats and she became great friends during her visit.  She likes cats much better than those pesky squirrels that she likes to chase.

Apply today to bring this special girl home.

name: Carrie Carroll
description:
Are you a Mary Kate or an Ashley? A Beyonce or a Solange? A Carrie or a Reba?

I’m a Carrie, of course, and there’s a splash of Queen Bey for good measure. Being a Carrie means that I’m smart, lovable, and loving. My favorite part of life is when visitors come to spend time with me while my family finds me, because I adore attention and cuddles and will confidently seek them out while I explore my surroundings (that’s the Bey part of me, if I’m being honest). I’m really curious about new things, since my old life wasn’t too great, but I feel great about my future: you can tell because I’m always smiling! And when I get to play with other dogs, learn new skills (like walking beautifully on a leash!), or hang out with special people (from little ones to big people), I smile so big that it nearly reaches my beautiful green eyes, which, like Beyonce’s, are always perfectly made up with a smoky “I woke up like this” look. While I’m naturally this cute, smart, and sweet, I get better every day, and I can’t wait to have a family of my own to teach me new tricks and share love with!

If you’re wondering about who Reba is, that’s my sister Reba, who’s also up for adoption! If you’re wondering about who Beyonce or Solange are, I can’t help you there, but if you’re looking for a gorgeous, social, and eager-to-please pup who’s up for anything, I’m your girl!

Breed: Pit Bull Terrier mix
Sex: Female
Age: 1 year old
Weight: 40 lbs
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative 
Microchipped: Will up date

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Unknown, but should do well based on personality. 
Good with Dogs: Yes

name: Missy Mae
description:
Who says you can’t find love as a mature lady? A curvy girl seeking a family to love her, Missy Mae was married before but left high and dry, and she’s looking for commitment, so if you’re here to play around, keep swiping! 

Missy Mae’s dream date -- and dream life -- involves short walks (beach optional), lots of cuddles, and some spa time with you and a brush, and she promises you’ll love to brush and pet her soft fur. She loves to be loved and cuddled, and her foster calls her a super-mellow, sweet-as-sugar wigglebutt. A real mother hen, Missy Mae is loving and gentle even with puppies, and she enjoys spending time with her foster’s kitty, potentially because her guilty pleasure is cat food. She’s a quiet, dignified lady who rarely barks (not even at chickens and ducks!), does terrific walking on a leash, and has excellent homemaking skills. She’s housebroken with a doggie door and hasn’t chewed anything, even though her foster mom doesn’t kennel her: she’s that trustworthy! 

	Missy Mae’s heart is even bigger than her backside, and she’s working on losing some weight and getting even more of a spring in her step. Now that she’s on meds for arthritis, she feels great, but she’ll do best in a relationship with a family whose home doesn’t have too many stairs and where there aren’t any small kids who might touch her sensitive back. Missy Mae would be great as your only woman, or in a home with other mature pups who enjoy the finer things in life.

Missy Mae is hopeful for a second chance at love, and if you’re looking for a dog to join you in a slower pace of life -- watching the sun set, stopping to smell the roses, and endless snuggling -- swipe right for a first date!


Check out her videos!

name: Bentley
description:
Bentley hails from Memphis, TN - who doesn't these days??  
Anyhoo.... this guy is adorable - we think he's a hound/lab mix. - he does really well with other dogs, loves to play so at least one other dog in the house would be perfect. 
Leash training is in the works and he's catching on pretty well.   He's great in the car!!
His rescuer in Memphis was leaving the Memphis Animal Shelter one day and a gentleman dropped off a box of puppies - yes a box.   Full of puppies - someone else took most of them so our friend took the ones that were left and this little guy is safe and sound because of her.
He's 100% crate trained and in the one week his foster has had him, he's had one accident in the house so that's good news!  
Hope you'll consider Bentley for your new home!  

7.21.18:  Now in New England!

Happiest guy ever, wouldn't stop smiling if you paid him.  In cookies, of course.   Bentley is just an all-around cool dude in a loose mood, looking for a family that he could entertain with his beaming smile, winning personality and playfulness of a 14 month old!    Bentley has barked about twice since arriving, he's getting much better on leash, sulks when he has to go in his crate but doesn't make a peep once in it and is housetrained.  

Car rides, did someone mention car rides?  That's Bentley's fave past-time - sitting like a good boy watching the world go by, then taking the opportunity for some beauty zzzz's.  But he hopes there's a nice park, beach or trail at the end of the trip as he LOVES adventures, and particularly the water!

Interested in a buddy to ride shotgun?  Give him a ring:  pawsjeanne@gmail.com

Name: Bentley
Breed:  Hound/Lab Mix
Sex:  Male
Age: 14 months old as of 8/3/18
Weight:  51 pounds
Spayed/Neutered:  Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm:  Negative 
Microchipped:  Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Yes- has been around children 10 months and older and did well
Good with Dogs: Yes-fostering with a bunch - puppies to seniors and loves them all
Good with Cats: No

name: Bo Jack
description:
Handsome chocolate boy - lover of humans, cuddler extraordinaire......

Jack is fostering here in New England - his foster mom looks at him every day and just can't believe what a great dog he is - she has contemplated keeping him but really feels he needs more one on one - she has three other dogs so she's doing what's best for him.

Jack would love room to run - a fenced yard would be fantastic or someone that will take him for long walks and maybe eventually off leash adventures.

Extremely affectionate with humans - he'd do great with all ages and sizes, little ones too.

A definite NO on the felines - he has a prey drive that would not lend itself to smaller non-dog animals in his home and he's been tested with cats - definitely no.

He is great with dogs but needs slow intro's - he's not a dog park kind of dog but if you have a female in your home, he's going to enjoy himself immensely.  He tolerates males but we'd look for a home with a female for him.

Completely housetrained, zero issues in this regard and a good eater!!

His foster mom would love to tell you more about him - you can email her here: joannepawsne@gmail.com.

Age: 2-3 years old
Weight: 45 lbs

name: Bauer Minestrone
description:
Mm! M'm! Good!  That is what everyone keeps saying about the Campbell Soup litter!  Bauer Minestrone was originally found with his mother hiding under a house and was adopted as a puppy by a loving family.  Unfortunately, they returned him recently because they couldn't give him the attention that he needed.  It's a hard decision but we respect that they are looking out for what is best for Bauer.   

Bauer is a wonderful dog.  He is great with kids!  He lived with a 7, 5, and 3 year old and was known for his hugs (he gives hugs!).  

Bauer is housebroken, likes his crate (goes in on command), and walks well on a leash.  

Bauer is a bit on the timid side, but he warms up fast.  He gets along well with other dogs of all sizes (has met dogs from 10 to 50 pounds).   

Bauer is active and would love a house where he can run and play.   

Hurry and apply because he is going to be ladled right up! 



Name: Bauer Minestrone Campbell
Sex: Male
Breed: Hound Heeler Mix
Age: 1 year 4 months as of 6/2018
Weight: 70 pounds as of 6/2018  
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative. On preventative.
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:

name: Blaze
description:
In the spirit of full disclosure, Blaze tends to spend a fair amount of time in this position.... https://youtu.be/-ifPxCdTFiI

Want a "rockstar" dog - here he is!!

This handsome red guy has recently undergone an evaluation with Heather Gutshall of Outbound Hounds and she said he's an awesome dog!!    He passed his temperament test with flying colors!!!  

Dogs or no dogs - he'd be great for you.  He does like to play and is a strong boy so if you have a small dog looking for a playmate, probably not ideal.

Blaze is currently fostering in Providence and his foster mom just adores him - he entertains himself when needed, crates nicely (in a sturdy crate) but does seem to be a magician and can get out of the regular wire crates.

There is no question this is a strong and powerful boy - we are looking for someone with breed experience.

His leash manners are currently in flux - meaning, working on those!!

If you're looking for a gorgeous, gorgeous representative of the bully breed family, this is your guy!

Breed: Pit Bull Terrier/Staffordshire Bull Terrier
Sex: Male

name: Camellia
description:
What is a Camellia? Well, it’s a vibrant, southern flower with some pretty inspiring symbolism! For instance, it symbolizes faithfulness and the coming of Spring. Pretty beautiful sounding, huh? Well, it is quite fitting that this stunning 2-year old pit bull is named Camellia. She herself is a faithful southern gal, on a quest for her furever home. Could it be you?

We firmly believe that Camellia lives up to the beauty of her name. She is extremely loving, well-mannered, and playful. She’s the kind of gal that can easily be the life of the party but would also prefer being in by 9pm for a quiet night on the couch! We don’t know about you but that is our kind of girl!

Camellia was rescued by her foster Mom from a high-kill shelter. Her personality was just far too sweet and she wanted to give this gal a second chance at life! Since she’s been living at home with her foster Mom, Camellia has really come into bloom (pun intended). She lives in playful harmony with the resident canines. And, gosh, is it playful harmony. Camellia LOVES to play with other dogs. She would be thrilled to learn that a family with another dog wanted to adopt her! However, it's not necessary to have another dog in the home. Just a bonus for Camellia!

Did we mention that Camellia has a pretty good amount of energy? What does this mean for you, her potential family, you ask? Well, it means you have a jogging partner extraordinaire. And a dog that will scale a mountain, faithfully by your side! A dog that would love running along the beach or skipping through the local dog park, stopping only occasionally to smell a few flowers and, OF COURSE, play with other dogs! 

Camellia is a medium to high energy girl. Smart and eager to please, she will be FUN to train. She’d be a great partner in agility training or other fun, doggy training.

Camellia truly is an all around great dog. With her stunning good looks and the personality to boot, we sure hope you’ll consider applying to adopt Camellia. We know she will be *wicked* excited to move to New England!

Check out this SUPER sweet video of Camellia to see just how great she is! https://youtu.be/C86XlB4ttYo
 




Name: Camellia
Breed: Pit bull/Lab Mix
Sex: Female
Age: approx. 2 year
Weight:  45 lbs
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative 
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with Dogs: Yes, she is currently fostered with dogs of all sizes. 
Good with Cats: No
Good with Kids: She is a big energetic dog so older children might be better since she accidentially might knock smaller kids over.

name: Gigi
description:
Gigi – Fostered in New England!!

This girl is a total catch!  This lab/pointer mix is the perfect combination of fun and quirky.  She even comes with the pointer skills.  Gigi’s new England foster mom cant say enough good things and she has been tested with kids multiple times with success!  We haven’t cat tested her, but her foster mom down south said she has a keen interest in them so we’re looking for a home without cats. 

Gigi is an all-around amazing girl.  She came to us through a partner shelter in Tennessee after her owner passed away and the family wasn’t able to take care of her.  Luckily, she came to PAWS!  Her days of being boarded are long gone and she’s setting into the New England life. 

We can clearly see that Gigi's previous owner had an awesome dog.  Fair warning, you may find bones in all sorts of funky places in the yard and home.  (planters, bushes, a couch) She has a 4 year old temperament with the funny tendencies of a puppy!  <3

Here are a few comments from her foster mom:

*Gigi is an awesome, loving, gently lady, that has an entertaining, funny personality. 
*She's a great watch dog, and now knows the vehicles that belong in our driveway. 
*She's very smart and a quick learner. 
*She loves her walks, is great on a leash doesn't pull. 
*Gigi is being kid tested and has done great.  Also, she’s perfect with new adults (strangers) coming into the home. 


Name: Gigi
Sex: Female
​Breed: Pointer/Lab Mix
Age: Approx 4 years old
Weight: Approx 45 pounds 
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with Dogs: Yes, previously lived with 3 mellow/laid back dogs
Good with Cats: No
Good with Kids: Unknown. Based on personality we think she would be fine

Adoption Donation: ​$250

name: Traveler
description:
The rumors are true! Traveler is the next Bachelor. His adoring fans and all the lucky contestants competing for his heart can’t wait to see who gets the final rose from this endearing, innocent, and joyful boy. Like many Bachelor candidates before him, Traveler loves to give and get attention and to kiss humans...and other dogs! 

Traveler’s adorably expressive ears and charming underbite woo the ladies and gentlemen, and so does his playful, sweet, sensitive, and pure of heart personality. He loves attention and will engage his people in play by stealing something (like a dish towel, but also their hearts) while they watch and then running around to play chase. He loves fetch, he loves to walk on leash, he loves to learn, he loves car rides, he loves to get pets...there’s not much Traveler doesn’t love. He even comes when called and enjoys getting brushed! What a dreamboat.

Traveler’s perfect match is a patient, loving home that’s pretty calm and quiet indoors but outdoorsy and adventurous, too. He’d be great as a solo dog who gets to socialize since he’s happiest when he’s with another dog, and he does also would be a perfect fit for a home with a confident, mellow dog whose zen ways he can mimic; with crazier dogs, he can have a little too much fun, but he takes correction well and would love to play with his high-energy friends at a dog park. His foster mom - who turns into the emoji with heart eyes when she talks about him - says he’s a diamond in the rough, and with just a little polish from a great family, he will be just as sparkly and flawless as the diamond engagement ring that comes with the final rose! 

Check out his video!
https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=10211027892722891&id=1522178203
 

Name: Traveler
Breed: Cattle Dog mix

name: Reggie
description:
Have you ever heard a dog described as bombproof? It means that their disposition is so great, so unshakable, that they aren’t bothered by much. Baths? No problem. Chickens? Fine. Cats? Whatever. Thunderstorms? So what. Car rides? Cool. That’s Reggie: this solid, super-sweet boy is cool and calm in all sorts of situations. His foster mom hasn’t even heard him bark!

Reggie is a mellow guy who grew up at the K9 Savior Sanctuary in Tennessee. He was one of ten litter mates rescued from a roadside ditch when they were tiny babies, and boy, did he grow! Now a big boy with the sweetest, happiest grin, Reggie was chosen to move into one of our amazing foster homes to get ready for his forever family. Reggie’s ideal forever family will be laid-back and easygoing, just like him. He’s still figuring out how leashes work, so he may not be ready to go on hikes, but he’s making great progress, and if you rub his ears and face, he will be all yours and let you know it by ravishing you with kisses. He loves to be brushed, and he even lets his foster mom bathe him and clean his ears. He wants to look his best for all his adoring fans!

In addition to being extra-lovable and truly imperturbable, Reggie does amazingly with every dog he’s met, including young, bouncy pups who get in his face. He’s housebroken with a doggie door and so well behaved that when he’s in his kennel with the door closed but not locked, he doesn’t sneak out; he just hangs out instead. Reggie is eager to please and learns quickly, and he’s easy to please, too, happy to frolic in a big field, join you for a drive, or spend a lazy day watching TV with you (all while smiling, of course!). What more could you want than this rock-solid rock star Reggie?

Check out his adorable videos!

name: Chavez
description:
Now fostering in New England! 

Chavez is one happy dude!! This boy has a zest for life that is contagious. He seems to love every human and dog that he meets. When at the dog park he plays with all the dogs of varying size and personality. He can play a little rowdy, but takes correction very well. He loves his rope toy and will happily engage in some tug o war. Chavez is a smart boy and already knows sit. We think he'd make a great candidate for further basic training. 
If you're looking for a playmate for your resident dog(s) we hope you'll consider Chavez!

name: Spice
description:
Woof, I’m Spice. I love snuggling with my foster family, especially my fur foster sister! We love playing together! I also love long walks on the beach, but I’m not too picky, I love any type of walk! My favorite thing is when I get chest and belly rubs when my foster family comes home from this place they call work. My foster mommy says I’m just one of the sweetest dogs out there, and I even have better manners than my foster sister. When we walk together, she barks at anything with a tail. But not me, I just keep on walking. My foster mommy tells me all the time that I’m such a good girl!

A few people have been interested in bringing me home, but I’m very bad at first impressions. The beginning of my life was ruff, so I’m very afraid when I meet someone new. People want me to love them and pet me right away, but that makes me so nervous. I need some time before I know that I can trust you. Once you have my trust, I will be your loyal companion. Foster mommy said she’s already seen me improve with proper introductions to new people. She even brought me to obedience class. She says I crushed it!

I feel better around new people when they have a dog for me, so I need a dog in my new home to show you how good I can really be! I love other dogs, but just like people, I need a little sniff to get to know them before I really want to play with them. I’m not sure about having little kids running around in my new home, but I think I would like older human children. I would love for my furever home to be a quiet, relaxing place, with not very many scary strangers coming in and out. Are you the patient loving family that’s willing to give me a chance?

name: Hugo
description:
Fostering in New England!! 

Hugo has a zest for life! This fella is all fun and love!  He is a total sweetheart who loves people to death. He kisses everyone who comes in and follows his foster mom everywhere she goes. He loves his comfy beds, belly rubs and playing with his canine brother. Walks are a big treat, but he is leash reactive to other dogs (he is excited to to meet the smaller dogs, but can be aggressive towards larger dogs). He is excellent with dogs he is familiar with and adjust his play style to match. You can see in his eyes and total body demeanor that we wants to please his people.  He has learned to sit and lay down.  We are working on stay, jumping and leash reactivity, luckily Hugo loves his food and pleasing people so he is easy to train. He'd likely make a great jogging buddy, since he loves to run.

Look into Hugo's gorgeous tawny eyes, and you will fall in love...

name: Ruby
description:
Beautiful, gentle Ruby grew up at the K9 Savior Sanctuary in Tennessee after being abandoned with her siblings as a tiny pup. Now at 6 years old, she’s been moved to a foster home, is doing amazing and is available for adoption. 

Ruby’s personality is calm, quiet, shy, loving and affectionate. She has low energy when indoors but occasionally gets a burst of joyful energy. Mornings are her favorite and when foster mom says "you ready Ruby girl" she prances down the hall with a big smile and tail wags (sometimes she even does a few laps). 

She LOVES human company and makes the perfect lap dog and snuggle buddy.  She will nuzzle your arm or leg seeking for attention. She follows her foster mom around and always finds the best spot to be close when taking a nap. She is the perfect gardening companion and will lay next to you in the cool grass or dirt.

She has gained confidence in her new foster home and has been introduced to many new things like sleeping indoors, mirrors, TV's, couches, stairs, neighborhood walks and the beach.  She approaches each new thing timidly but with patience and gentle encouragement she has overcome many of her insecurities.  Seeing her relax, smile and roll in the grass or sand will melt your heart. She is such a sweetheart!

Ruby has done well with several of the dogs in her foster home but would also do fine as an only dog (less competition for your attention). She is well behaved in the car and in public settings as long as you avoid large crowds and chaos. She is extremely gentle (and slow paced) on the leash. She is housebroken.

She needs slow and proper introductions to new people. We recommend a walk around the neighborhood on neutral ground because she is nervous and fearful of new people (will shake, cower and bark if they approach to fast). When people are calm, patient, understanding and allow time for her to get to know and approach them she becomes more comfortable and will seek attention when she trusts them. 

Ruby would do best in a quiet home without children.  She really likes a routine and a calm quiet palace to retreat when company is over. We recommend a fenced yard for Ruby because things from the outside world sometimes scare her (landscapers, garbage trucks, motorcycles, loud trucks).

Her foster family just adores her and thinks she is one of the easiest and sweetest foster dogs they have ever had. She is so easy to fall in love with!

If you would like more information on this sweet, gentle dog Ruby, please submit an application, and her Adoption Coordinator will be in touch. 

Check out her video below!

www.facebook.com/deborah.h.testa/videos/10210696818086232/

https://photos.app.goo.gl/FhkqNE9tP7K7QF9NA

name: Dorothy
description:
Now Fostering in CT!!

Dorothy and her sisters, Rose & Sophia, were abandoned in the rain on the service road next to a shelter in Tennessee.   After realizing their owner wasn’t coming back these girls took it upon themselves to chase some squirrels in the surroundings woods. Luckily, a shelter employee spotted them and with some very fragrant (and tasty) do g food was able to lure them to safety. Rose & Sophia have since been adopted, but Dorothy still patiently waits for her forever home. And we’re determined to find that for her!

Dorothy is a sweet and loving girl. She is very shy upon first meeting new people, but with time, patience and love warms up to be a fabulous companion. She finds new places rather scary, but can deal with them with her person’s help.

She gets along with other dogs, and would do best living with another dog.  If there’s another dog in her forever home, it should be a confident dog that can be a role model.

Since we know from her days on the loose she runs when frightened, she must have a fenced yard.  This isn’t a requirement for all dogs, but this will be mandatory for a family that wants to love Dorothy.  

We would love to see this precious girl join a loving and patient home where she will be given the time to continue to blossom. If that’s you, we want to hear from you!  Sweet Dorothy is waiting!



Name: Dorothy
Breed: Beagle mix
Sex: Female
Age: Approx 1 year old
Weight: Approx 35 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes, on 1/2/17
Vaccinations: Up to date 12/22/17
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Good with Children: Yes, based on personality. Due to initial shyness would do best with older/quiet kids.
Good with Dogs: Yes, except for very high energy dogs.
Good with Cats: Passed initial cat test. May do well with proper introductions.

name: Peter (aka Pogo)
description:
Please send inquiries to mchen.pawsne@gmail.com 

Are you looking for a cuddlebug? Well, you found me!! My name is Pete (aka Pogo) and I am a 3.5 year old hound/terrier mix. 

I love to play, run, swim, and go for walks. One of my favorite games is fetch!! I would be so happy to go on car rides and hang out with my humans. I am full of life and will give you endless kisses in return. 

My foster dad says I'm totally ready for a furever home. I am a loyal companion and really good at showing my affection. Did I mention that I am house and crate trained?
 
I am a really good student too! I recently completed training classes with one of the best local trainers, Heather Gutshall of Outbound Hounds. I was even named Student of the Week.  I love doing my homework with my foster dad and he says I learn commands like a champ!

I am eager to go on adventures with my very own family.  Please fill out an adoption form for me! 


Name: Peter (Pogo)

Sex: Male
Breed: Hound/Terrier Mix
Age: Approx 4.5 years as of 06/2018
Weight: 56 lbs    
Spayed/Neutered: Yes  
Vaccinations: Up to date 
Heartworm: negative
Microchipped: Yes


BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Dogs:  No, prefers to be an only dog
Good with Cats: No

name: Bessie Smith
description:
If you are looking for a great dog who loves everyone, is housebroken and is doing great with obedience training then Bessie is your girl! 

Bessie is very very sweet and loves everyone she meets and everyone that meets her loves her! She does need to be the only animal in the house. She is working hard on leash training and is getting better at not training! She takes food and treats very gently and is food motivated so she is learning obedience training quickly! 

Bessie is a great dog and with a family committed to training and understanding her needs she will do well. 

We had Bessie formally evaluated by a trainer as we do with all of our bigger dogs and she did quite well - we have the report available for any adopter - in short, she is a dominant girl who is a fast learner and will be a great pet in almost any home.

Name: Bessie Smith
Breed: Pit Bull Terrier mix
Sex: Female
Age: 3 years
Weight: 58 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative 
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Yes-older children secondary to her size and her "bounciness."
Good with Dogs: No
Good with Cats: No

name: Nikki
description:
Nikki is a happy girl with a beautiful smile and the personality to match. She came to us when her owners moved and were not able to take Nikki with them to their new house. Despite having a lot of change thrown at her at once, Nikki has been going with the flow and is super excited to meet her new forever family. Nikki is currently living with three other dogs and is very friendly with them and has been enjoying tug-of-war and other fun games. She does seem to get a bit nervous when other, unfamiliar, dogs are in her face, but she has not demonstrated any aggression. Nikki adores spending time with her human pals and loves to give kisses! This gorgeous girl is house trained, crate trained, travels well in a car, and is doing a great job learning how to walk on a leash. She is an absolute sweetheart and a wonderful companion.

 
Name: Nikki
Breed: Pit Bull Terrier
Sex: Female
Age: as of 12/01/2017: Approximately 6 years
Weight: 47 lbs.
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Heartworm: Negative 
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: Nikki has lived with kids and does well with older, respectful children
Good with Dogs: Yes- see bio above
Good with Cats: Unknown

name: Sadie
description:
Bubba, Jim Bob, June Bug, Sadie and Ellie Mae were all found together after being dumped in a rural area in Arkansas. They were being shot at and were rescued in the knick of time! All four are very timid and need a family that is understanding of their beginnings and willing to work with a fearful dog. They are all extremely sweet and just need a soft place to land so they can learn to trust again! They are all now kennel and leash trained!  Their current foster mom is working with them to come out of their shells. If you think you are up for the challenge of a timid dog consider one of these dogs- the reward of seeing them grow is worth it!  

Name: Sadie
Breed: Shepherd Mix
Sex: Female
Age: 3 years old 
Weight: 65 pounds
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date
Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS: 
Good with Children: No
Good with Dogs: Yes
Good with Cats: No

name: Hershey
description:
Resist this dog - dare you -      https://youtu.be/Je5KluzH_7I

Fostering in Providence

Please, please, please give me a home with kids - I adore them and the trainer said I should be put in a home with them because I love them so much!!!

I can't wait to get 'dopted! I've been in New England for a little while now, and loving it...especially the Dunkin Donut's drive-thru sausage patties --- oh man. My foster Ma says I'm a very good copilot in the car, I sit quietly and keep her company when she is doing errands. In return, she always gets me a treat. I love treats and I will do anything for them!

But anyway, back to me getting 'dopted. I am really hoping for a Mom and/or Dad who will understand that, in spite of my size, I AM A LAP DOG, and I need lots of hugs and kisses. In return, I promise lots of licks and snuggles. I am a very sweet girl, and mostly I just like to hang out with my humans, whether it is snoozing on the couch, sharing treats at the dinner table, riding in the car, or going for a leasure walk. I like to keep them safe when they go to the bathroom too... you know, they need my company at all times...I also like tennis balls a lot too, and peanut butter although not necessarily in that order.

I am looking for a home where I can be the only dog. I don't mind dogs when I'm out on a leashed walk, but I don't want to share my hoomans with any other canine fellows. I am also a bit too interested in cats and other furry and winged creatures, so it is best that I am the only pet in the home. I currently live with two very dog-savvy children, aged 13 and 10. I do great with them and their friends, I just need proper introduction.

Attached are some pictures of me, so you can see how good looking I am. But my Foster Ma says the cutest thing about me is how I'm missing one of my bottom front teeth, and she also likes my clumsy walk.

So....are we lapmates or what?
 
 
NOTE:  Hershey has been through an extensive board and train with a premier pittie trainer who feels she is a fantastic dog who adores children so a home with t hem or exposure to them would be amazing.  She potentially could learn to live with another dog but the way we look at it, why?   She should get to live in the best situation possible for her.

Name: Hershey
Sex:  Female
Breed: American Bulldog/Lab mix (best guess)
Age: Approx. 6 years old
Weight:  Approx 60 lbs
Spayed/Neutered: Yes
Vaccinations: Up to date as of July 2017
Heartworm: Treated 3/6  
Microchipped:  Yes 
 
BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:
Dogs: Hershey would be best as the only dog, though she is not leash reactive and can easily be around many other dogs in a leashed social setting. 
Cats: No
Kids:  Definitely a yes per her trainer, foster who has children.

name: Zane
description:
Now fostering in New England!!!
 
Zane is an adorable 9 year old dachshund mix who is looking for her forever family!  Zane is very active for her age and loves to go for walks and run around her foster family’s backyard with her foster and human siblings.  Like most dogs her age she does have some minor health concerns.  She is currently being treated for glaucoma in one eye and is on arthritis medication.  Please contact us to learn more about this beautiful, deserving girl! 

Name: Zane
Sex: Female
Breed: Dachshund Mix
Age: 8.5 years old 
Weight: 20 pounds 
Spayed/Neutered: Yes

Microchipped: Yes

BASED ON OUR OBSERVATIONS:

name: Hooch
description:
Poor Hooch has had quite the last few months! He was found by a nice homeless women but he had an injury that she was unable to care for. Thankfully they were found by a PAWS volunteer and next thing you knew Hooch was on his way to the good life! 

Hooch is a very sweet pitiful/mastiff mix. He is about 2 years old. He loves his kong and belly rubs! He is working on basic obedience training and with continued work and patience he will do well! 

This gorgeous boy is deserving of an amazing forever home! Please consider adding him to your pack!
